127001.name: Speed Powers
127001.description:
From publisher blurb:

Faster than the eye can see, perhaps able to outrace light itself: Speed Powers are all about moving and reacting fast. Zoom from one side of the world to another in the blink of an eye. Defy gravity, running up walls or across the surface of water. Even vibrate your body to pass through walls or travel across time and other dimensions! Accomplish a week's work in an instant, and have the villains in jail before they even realize you've moved.

127002.name: Earth Powers
127002.description:
From publisher blurb:

Powers as solid and strong as bedrock. In the third part of our elemental powers set, we look at Earth Powers, control over soil and stone, and taking on those properties to become as strong and tough as the Earth itself. Hurl rocks and form stone armor, shape earthen and stone barriers, ride waves of dirt, and move through the ground as if it were water. The powers of the Earth are yours!

127003.name: Illusion Powers
127003.description:
From publisher blurb:

There is more to these powers than meets the eye. Who needs control over forces or matter when you can control perception itself? With Illusion Powers, make yourself unseen and unheard, or create a false image for your foes to waste their attacks upon. Twist the environment to appear any way that you want, and allow your foes to defeat themselves once they can no longer trust what they see, hear, or feel. Nothing is what it seems with the power of illusion!

127004.name: Air Powers
127004.description:
From publisher blurb:

From the unleashed power of a hurricane wind or destructive tornado to drawing the breath from your target's lungs, Air Powers command the life-giving atmosphere all around us. Whip up wind blasts and shields to protect you from attack. Fly on the wings of the wind, and let it carry your words across great distances as you snuff out fires and the consciousness of your foes just as easily.

127005.name: Kinetic Powers
127005.description:
From publisher blurb:

Want powers that have some impact? Kinetic Powers have a lot of impact, enough to blast through steel and stone, and they can take a lot of impact, too, blocking bullets, blasts, and explosions. From telekinesis to projected force field and kinetic blasts, the powers in this profile can put things into motion or stop them in their tracks.

127006.name: Luck Powers
127006.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fighting crime, stopping disasters, and saving the Earth: it just takes a little luck. Okay, it takes a lot of luck. Fortunately (see what we did there?) Luck Powers gives you the tools to create characters with incredible good luck, who can also be a jinx on their foes. From Probability Control to Narrow Escapes and Lucky Shots, and more. So ask yourself ... are you feeling lucky?

127007.name: Magic Powers
127007.description:
From publisher blurb:

By the Scarlet Shades of Sirrion! In this special double-sized Power Profile, peer into the secrets of the arcane arts with a catalog of spells and occult entities based on the material from the Book of Magic sourcebook. Magic Powers has everything you need to outfit mystic heroes and villains with their amazing powers: more than 80 different spells and invocations!

127008.name: Talent Powers
127008.description:
From publisher blurb:

If Power Profiles demonstrate anything, it's that powers come in all types, including powers that aren't really "powers" per se, but extraordinary gifts of talent or training. Talent Powers takes a look at how to apply the power effects from M&M to create some extraordinary abilities that don't rely on exotic radiation, alien technology, or mystical or psychic awareness: nothing but pure talent!

127009.name: Morphing Powers
127009.description:
From publisher blurb:

Morphing Powers provide literal flexibility, from being able to stretch and change your shape to shifting around all of your physical abilities at will. This profile looks at the Morph effect and the Transformed condition alongside powers from Stretching and Malleable Form to full-fledged Shapeshifting.

127010.name: Meta Powers
127010.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are powers, and then there are powers about powers: Meta-Powers. This profile looks at the powers used to influence the powers of others, from Power Mimicry and Power Theft to Power Nullification and Nemesis, with a close look at the Variable effect from the core rules, the foundation of many of these powers.

127011.name: Plant Powers
127011.description:
From publisher blurb:

Plants are everywhere, surviving even in some of the harshest places on Earth. The Plant Powers profile offers powers that turn even the humblest plants into powerful allies, and grant plant-like powers of survival, adaptability, and endurance.

127012.name: Gravity Powers
127012.description:
From publisher blurb:

It's one of the fundamental forces of the universe, and a wielder of Gravity Powers can make things light as a feather or heavier than a mountain, soar through the air, and perhaps even harness the power of an almost infinitely-dense singularity!

127013.name: Element Powers
127013.description:
From publisher blurb:

Element Powers looks at the powers of the elements. Not earth, air, fire, and water, but argon, copper, radium, chlorine, mercury, hydrogen, and more. From taking on an element's power to transmuting the elements at will, the unleashed abilities of the periodic table are yours to command!

127014.name: Strength Powers
127014.description:
From publisher blurb:

Sure, some may fly through the air, throw energy blasts from their hands or eyes, or play with thoughts like a puppet’s strings, but then there are those who are strong. Strength Powers look at the things you can do with sheer muscle power and physical strength far beyond that of any mere mortal. Who needs other powers when you can be the strongest there is?

127015.name: Dragon World Hack
127015.description:
From Introduction:

It’s a time of adventure, of clashing swords and spells. It is an age ruled by the passions of the bold and the whims of the elder dragons. The world is full of hidden secrets and glittering treasures, of the legacies of the dragons, of allen empires, of the demon gods of ancient times.

There are mighty kingdoms, grand cities, and quaint villages, and wherever you came from, you are one of those rare people with the talent and power (or failing that, the bloody-minded determination) to leave your home to become an adventurer and seek your destiny.

Dragon World is a game for getting together with friends to make up stories about a bunch of passionate weirdoes running around getting into trouble in a bright, weird fantasy setting. It’s heavily inspired by 90s fantasy comedy anime and manga like Slayers and Dragon Half, though the rules are derived from D. Vincent Baker’s game Apocalypse World. Another way to think of it is it’s a game for playing just the really silly parts of a D&D campaign.

To play you’ll need some friends to play with (at least three people total), some six-sided dice (two per player), pencils, and paper. Printouts of the playbooks work best by far, but any paper will do in a pinch. One person is going to be the Dragon Master (or DM for short) and handle the overall game world, while the rest are players, who each have one character.


Dragon World Hack (Version 0.1)

Taking a cue from Dungeon World, this "Dragon World Hack" is a playable version of Dragon World, but requires the Apocalypse World rulebook (or at the very least a good knowledge of the game) in order to play. I’ll likely do a full stand-alone version with pictures and everything at some point, but for now I just want to share this fun thing I made.

127016.name: Foundry
127016.description:
From the Introduction:

An almost unbearable heat radiates through the open arches leading into this building, which is no big surprise as even a casual glance through these arched doorways will reveal that the building is a foundry.

Two big smelters built from fire resistant stones take up much of the space in the back. The heat radiating from them day and night is almost unbearable. The air is dry and hot which in turn makes every breath a torture. Much of the rest of the workshop is taken up by the canals and the mold for the liquid metal, formed from sand and sunken into the stone floor of the shop.

127017.name: Ammunition Bunker
127017.description:
From the Introduction:

Ever since the first bombard was put into service the storage of ammunition has been a unique problem. Modern artillery shells aren't as volatile as kegs and cast iron balls filled with black powder used to be, but their handling still demands extraordinary care and attention. Another problem was posed by artillery and other modern weapons. They made older fortifications pretty much obsolete and at the same time stores filled with ammunition have become prime targets.

This bunker is an example for modern ammunition storage taking these things into account. Its walls, as well as floors and ceilings are made of thick steel reinforced concrete, covered with a thick layer of soil and grass, both for additional protection and concealment. A single ramp leads down to the first massive steel door leading into an anteroom from where the actual storage area can be accessed through another such door.

A simple warning sign over the outer access hatch hints at the explosive contents of the bunker and only a few safety lamps provide illumination within, revealing rows of crates filled with mortar and artillery shells of various calibers equipped with a number of different payloads.

127018.name: D6 Magazine (Issue 4 - Apr 2012)
127018.description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

127020.name: Sargon 4
127020.description:
From the Game Box

"Sargon was the warlord who ruled the ancient world. Patient, cunning, a master strategist...and the inspiration for the new standard in computer chess, SARGON 4.

You can set SARGON's playing strength to any of sixteen levels, and then fine tune it to get the game that's right for you. If you're a little rusty, SARGON's many teaching features (such as on-line help, chess tutorial, hints, problems, and special novice mode) make improving your play both fun and easy. And even experts will be challenged by SARGON's chess algorithm, the most powerful available on a microcomputer.

SARGON's spectacular graphics are unequaled in computer chess. Whether you play in vivid 2-D or stunning 3-D, you choose from a large collection of beautifully crafted chess sets. Each set was created by a professional artist and rendered using the latest in advanced image processing and computer graphics technology. Or use the Piece Sculptor to create your own."

127021.description:
Nightfall: Crimson Siege is an expansion for the deck-building game Nightfall, a game in which players draft Minions that they then send to attack and inflict wounds upon their opponents. Nightfall: Crimson Siege takes players to the final stronghold in Europe where humanity makes its last stand at the Vatican. Some familiar faces return to help the weary souls as they fortify the city and await the hordes of ghouls to come.

Crimson Siege adds 24 minion cards and 30 "Summon" cards to Nightfall. Summon cards are a new card type in a standalone deck that allows players to summon more minions into play than ever before. Whenever a card with "Summon X" on it resolves its ability, you draw from the top of that deck and place a minion into play under your control. A variety of Ghouls are in the summon deck, and unlike other minions in Nightfall, when a Ghoul is destroyed, exiled, or otherwise removed from play, it goes back into the summon deck. Thus the supply of Ghouls to overwhelm your opponents will never run out!
127021.name: Nightfall: Crimson Siege

127022.name: Sargon V: World Class Chess
127022.description:
From the Game Box

“Pit your skills against an opponent with moves from professional games such as Karpov-Kasparov 1990 – thanks to International Chess Master, Dr. Danny Kopec. Try to anticipate the moves of the masters as you play Annotated Games. Guess at the right move, then learn if a move isn’t necessarily the best one and why. Sargon will even tell you which move you should actually make. The ultimate test? Select Tournament Play and challenge Sargon V at its most brilliant skill level under strict tournament time limitations.”

127023.description:
In Kemet, players each deploy the troops of an Egyptian tribe and use the mystical powers of the gods of ancient Egypt – along with their powerful armies – to score points in glorious battles or through invasion of rich territories. A game is typically played to 8 or 10 victory points, which may be accrued through winning attacks, controlling temples, controlling fully-developed pyramids, sacrificing to the gods, and wielding particular magical powers.

The conquest for the land of Kemet takes place over two phases: Day and Night. During the day, choose an action amongst the nine possible choices provided by your player mat and perform it immediately. Once every player has taken five actions, night falls, with players gathering Prayer Points from their temples, drawing Divine Intervention cards, and determining the turn order before the start of the new day.

As the game progresses, they can use Prayer Points to acquire power tiles. Some of these enroll magical creatures and have them join their troops. In addition to intimidating enemies, these creatures provide special powers!

Detailed miniature components represent the combat units and the supernatural creatures that are summoned to enhance them. Combat is resolved through cards chosen from a diminishing six-card hand and enhanced by bonuses.

Play By Forum

Kemet PBF #1

The Spiel #184 - Try To Take Over The World!
[Interview] Jacques Bariot  et Guillaume Montiage

boardgamehonor: 2013 Gioco dell’Anno Nominee
2013 Tric Trac Finalist
127024.description:
Trapped in a prison in which each room has four doors but apparently no exit, the players must try to find Room 25, the supposed exit to this nightmare. But some amongst them might be guardians of the prison, waiting for the right moment to strike. In the cooperative game Room 25, not everyone wants to escape from imprisonment – but who is the traitor? Each turn, the player moves are preprogrammed, requiring discussion, negotiation – and possibly betrayal.

Room 25 includes five different playing modes, from full cooperation to a solitaire game.
127024.name: Room 25
boardgamepodcastepisode: Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 015 – Top 10 Mechanisms
Episode 28 - Zombie Chickens & Hot Fondue
Episode 83- Salem and Daedalus Productions Contest
Zona Ludica 2013 Yarrrr!!! Ahoy Matey!

127026.name: Poker Texas Hold'em
127026.description:
Back of the box

Currently, this is the most dramatic game of Poker available!

Discover this alternative game of poker. Tailor your strategy in front of clever adversaries. Master the numbers, be logical and have a strong discipline!

Participate in tournaments or private games, know to wait for the right time to serve your cards or simply play for fun! Poker Texas Hold'em is the card game that will reveal your inner gamer.

127027.name: Casus Belli (Issue 26 - Jun 1985)
rpgissuearticle: Devine qui Vient Dîner ce Soir...: l'YSCWYD
Extraits de Impressions de Voyage du Sage Zormilius
Gazette Galactique - L'usage des armes à feu et rayons
De la tête dans le plomb !
Le château de la réalité multiple
Squad Leader: la route de Remagen
Toon: Un épisode edifiant de ma vie
127027.description:
User Summary:

In this issue:

* Nouvelles du Front
* Battle for the Ardennes, reviews of Battles for the Ardennes
* Infantry 39-60, infantry tactics between 1939 and 1960
* Narvik, review of GDW's Narvik
* Squad Leader, scenario for Squad Leader ("La route de Remagen")
* Amirauté, follow-up of the previous issue's article about the Crete invasion scenario in Amirauté
* De la tête dans le plomb!!!", introduction to miniature wargaming
* Tutti Frutti, article investigating the different genres of simulation games
* Ludotique, reviews of La Bête du Gévaudan, Le Mystère de Kikekankoi, Gemstone Warrior, Excalibur Quest
* L'enfer du décor, comic
* Devine qui vient diner ce soir, new monsters for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (1st Edition)
* La Gazette Galactique, new ranged combat rules for Mega
* Toon, review of Toon
* Empire Galactique, review of Empire Galactique (1st Edition)
* Sombre Tableau, solo adventure
* Le château de la réalité multiple, scenario for Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (1st Edition)
* Super Héros S.A., scenario for Villains & Vigilantes (1st Edition), Champions (1st Edition), Superworld or Marvel Super Heroes
* Petites Annonces

127028.description:
Description from the back of the Box:

You and your friends have just returned from a fruitful trick-or-treating journey. But now the real fun begins. The grownups have tasked you and your friends to fairly distribute the candy pile. But all of you have something else in mind. Be the one to get the most candy at the end of the game to win!

Tricks & Treats is a family-friendly card game for 2-4 players.

Gameplay

Each player takes turns placing candy into several numbered Halloween candy baskets on the table. The objective is to have the most candy in your basket by the end of the game. The catch is.. if another player can figure out which basket is yours, he/she can tattle on you and bump you out of the game.

Goal

The goal of the game is to have the most candy at the end of the game or to be the only player left in the game.
127028.name: Tricks & Treats
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 6: Emerson Matsuuchi

127029.name: Las guerras modernas
boardgamepodcastepisode: RJ50: De Magia Borras a VICTUS (l'edició de jocs de taula a Catalunya)
127029.description:
It's a game similar to chess and checkers, the background is the first world war, german versus french.
Each side has four different units: infantry (one move to front or side) , cavalry (one diagonal move, like checkers game), cannons (like towers in chess) and planes/zeppelins (like queens in chess).
There is a special unit, the standar-bearer, if you capture the enemy standar-bearer with one infantry or cavalry unit, your unit change to a cannon unit.
The board is divided by a river in the middle, the infantry and cavalry units cannot retreat until overpass the river.
The objetive to win is eliminate all the enemy units.

127030.name: Top Gear: Stunt School Revolution
127030.description:
User Summary

Top Gear: Stunt School Revolution is the successor to the in 2010 released Top Gear: Stunt School.

Again, your mission is to perform stunts as best as you can while not completely wrecking your vehicle.

For this title, you will be visiting Alcatraz, New York, Sydney, and more, with once again access to a compact, sports and utility car with many performance and/or viewer enhancing attributes available.

127031.name: Valngress: City of Ruins
127031.description:
From Introduction:

Valngress - City of Ruins is a setting for Dungeonslayers, which itself is an old fashioned roleplaying game of traditional fantasy, simple mechanics and dynamic action.

As the author of this supplement, my goal was to create an interesting and diverse environment that still matched the troupes of its parent game. Inspired by James Wolf Strehle’s work, I struck on the idea of an abandoned city full of dangers and riches. Although this background is often used in fantasy games, what better place for a party of adventurers to test their strength, fortitude and luck! The result is Valngress, City of Ruins, the heart of an ancient Elven kingdom that is lost to both time and the jungle.

127032.name: Zombieslayers
127032.description:
From publisher blurb:

BBRRAAAIIINNNNSSSS!

Zombie Creation System: Replicate the zombies from your favorite movies or video games to send at your players!
12 New Talents: Your survivors will need to learn new tricks to survive the zombie apocalypse!
Manage Your Supplies: Quick and easy supplement management rules, in spirit of "rules-lite" nature of Dungeonslayers - the world is in ruin and supplies are few and far between!

127033.name: Solitaire Royale
127033.description:
"Solitaire Royale is a computer solitaire card-game simulation. The game features colorful card-back designs, digitized sounds of cards shuffling, and eight solitaire games included."

Source: Wikipedia, "Solitaire Royale", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127034.name: ArmA II: British Armed Forces
127034.description:
Two months after the Allied military victory in Takistan, the new government is restoring the war-torn country. NATO forces assisting in this effort face the threat of insurgency, waged by the remnants of the defeated Takistani army in the mountaineous regions of Takistan. Company team of British paratroopers patrolling the treacherous mountains in Zargabad's vicinity is ordered to battle the amassing guerilla warriors.

Source: The Game Website.

127035.name: ArmA II: Private Military Company
127035.description:
One year after British and coalition armed forces successfully quelled the insurgent uprising in Takistan, the NATO Green Sea deployment is in the process of a strategic drawdown of combat troops in the region. Private military contractors shoulder the burden of the increased workload, with competition rising between the multinational organisations for lucrative security contracts. Private Military Company, ION, Inc. (formerly Black Element), successfully bid for a contract - codenamed Black Gauntlet - to provide security for a UN investigation team as they seek to piece together information regarding Takistan's abandoned nuclear weapons programme.

Source: The Game Website.

127036.name: ArmA II: Army of the Czech Republic
127036.description:
Bohemia Interactive proudly announces Arma 2: Army of the Czech Republic (A2: ACR), a brand new installment of the most authentic, diverse and open tactical military shooter series, Arma!
A2: ACR features a variety of authentically modeled units and vehicles together with detailed environments, demonstrating the various roles and deployments of modern Czech Armed Forces across varying theaters of war.

Bohemia Interactive´s CEO, Marek Spanel, added that:
"We're very happy for the opportunity to bring this fantastic DLC which focuses exclusively on our home army, the Army of the Czech Republic. We want to use this opportunity to pay tribute to all those brave Czech soldiers who are risking their lives in service around the world.”
Pre-orders are available from June 4th at Store.bistudio.com.
A2: ACR is scheduled for release exclusively for PC on Q3 2012.
A2: ACR Key Features:
•Czech Army - Bolster the Arma sandbox with a range of authentic Czech Army units and vehicles, including the L-159 Alca, Pandur II, and Dingo infantry mobility vehicle
•Authentic Weapons - Pick from a range of new weapons, including those developed with Česká Zbrojovka a.s.: CZ 805 BREN, CZ Scorpion EVO III and CZ 75 PHANTOM
•Diverse Missions - Deploy across 15 new missions in the singleplayer campaign, scenarios and procedural template gameplay modes
•Verdant Environments - Explore the two new summer-season terrains: Bystrica and Bukovina

Source: The Developer Website.

127037.name: First Strike
127037.description:
User Summary

First Strike is an arcade game similar to After Burner, but with an added strategic element in that the loadout and fuel must be selected for each mission. Different weapons are effective against different targets.


From the Manual

This is no ordinary plane - in fact, some say it is the ultimate conventional air-combat weapons system - and it's all yours!

Your mission is to carry out raids against specific targets in enemy territory, running the gauntlet of hostile aircraft, missiles and land- and sea-based forces.

If successful, you will be promoted; but in a first strike situation, only the most accomplished pilot will win through. Flying by day and night, from bases as far apart as the Arctic and the Mediterranean, it is up to you to select the weapons you need for the job.

But don't overload your plane or take too little fuel, even though you can restock and effect repairs at designated rendezvous points, you must calculate the odds exactly to survive!

Credits

Coding: Dave Thomas
Graphic Design: Bob Thomas
Design Coordination: Peter Cook
Sonix: Mark Cooksey

127038.name: Assassin's Creed: Revelations – The Lost Archive
127038.description:
The story DLC is dubbed The Lost Archive. It focuses on Subject 16, includes Lucy, and details 16's entry into the Assassins, and his capture by Abstergo. It was released on February 28, 2012. Following Subject 16's apparent death by drowning in the Tiber river, 16 is recruited by the Assassins to infiltrate Abstergo and steal information relating to the prototype Animus. After learning of the importance of the Animus to Abstergo, the Assassins arrange for 16 to be captured, later to be freed by Lucy, who is revealed to be a Templar triple agent. It is heavily implied she was enraged at her apparent abandonment at Abstergo by the Assassin order. 16 also inadvertently targets Desmond as another target by revealing Ezio Auditore as the Assassin Mentor. Lucy, realizing 16 has learned of her allegiance, allows 16 to be driven insane by the Animus and is planning to stage escape with Desmond so that he can lead the Templars to another Apple of Eden. After completing the sequence, 16's conscious is caught in "The Loop" a cycle of memories buried within Desmond. After collecting disparate fragments, a backdoor is revealed, allowing 16's consciousness to send a parting letter to his father, with whom he had a constantly strained relationship due to his mother's abandonment

Source: Wikipedia, "Assassin's Creed: Revelations", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127039.name: Battlefield 3: Close Quarters
videogamedeveloper: EA Digital Illusions CE AB (EA DICE)
127039.description:
The second DLC, "Close Quarters" arrives in June 2012 featuring four new infantry-oriented maps, ten new weapons, HD Destruction, ten new assignments, five unique Dogtags, and a new game mode, Conquest Domination, a Conquest mode adapted for smaller spaces

Source: Wikipedia, "Battlefield 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127040.name: Battlefield 3: Armored Kill
videogamedeveloper: EA Digital Illusions CE AB (EA DICE)
127040.description:
The third DLC, "Armored Kill" arrived on September 4, 2012 for premium PS3 users and September 11 for Xbox 360 and PC users. The DLC will be made availabable for Non-premium PS3 and Xbox 360 users on September 25, 2012. Armored Kill is set to include new vehicles, specifically mentioned are tanks, ATVs, and mobile artillery, as well as new vehicle-oriented maps and what is called "the biggest map in Battlefield history".

Source: Wikipedia, "Battlefield 3", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127043.name: Fantail Baseball
127043.description:
Fantail Line presents "Fantail Baseball"
Fantail Baseball is a board game agile and very fun where two teams try to get more runs that your opponent and so win the match.
Smart Charts printed on both sides, (4) per team, are designed so that the rules and tactics of baseball can be developed on the game board.
The symbols printed on the game board are directly related to the symbols printed on smart charts.
A twelve-sided roll dice is used by both teams in turn.
Each smart chart has a space at the top which takes into account the throwing of the pitcher, being the possibilities strike, ball and ball in play.
The different options related to the steal of bases are represented in smart charts.
The team that is in the field, throw the 12-sided roll dice by means of your pitcher to determine if the throwing becomes a strike, a ball or a hit the ball into the field.
The team that is at bat, throw the same 12-sided roll dice to determine whether steals bases, if makes a full strike, if produces a home run or if the runner is out.
The smart chart in use will indicate the different positions of the pieces of both teams on the board and also of the ball.

127044.name: Quest for the Fazzlewood
127044.description:
User Summary:

Tournament module for one DM and one thief player that was run during Wintercon VII in Detroit. It was later revised and published by TSR as O1: The Gem and the Staff

127045.name: Shenandoah: A Civil War Miniatures Campaign System
127045.description:
A set of campaign rules with a map for playing a campaign game set in 1863 in the Shenandoah Valley.

Comes with a set of counters, 2 grand tactical maps, and the rules booklet

127047.name: Alternativa
127047.description:
Alternativa is a classic point&click adventure game based on the original sci-fi/cyber-punk script which is composed of a number of shorter stories that lead us through the lives of individual characters as well as the fictional world of the future. Non-linear storyline full of unexpected turns, at times spine-chilling atmosphere, logical tasks, historical and scientific facts – Alternativa is all of that.

Although Alternativa is a very complex and elaborate world, the story concludes in a logical and gripping manner. All the questions are answered. At the same time, new thoughts and goals surface. And it's these goals that the heroes of Alternativa try to achieve in the sequel which develops directly from the first part without forcing the player to know all the previously revealed facts.

Source: The Developer Website.

127048.description:
“In 1976, as the specter of nuclear war loomed worldwide, the UN Security Council introduced Resolution 501. Known as the Table-Tennis Accords, it decreed that all conflict between nations be resolved through the dialect of Ping-Pong. When Chinese terrorists struck down the US Table Tennis Team in 1979, a rag-tag band of students was forced to play in their stead. Lead by rivals Johnathan Gabriel and Tycho Brahe, they were victorious – but not unharmed. Now, in 1984, the Russian Bear has begun to stir. In times like these, America needs men whose grip is sure. Men who play the entire table.”

Penny Arcade: Paint The Line ECG: Red Tide, an expandable card game, features fast and furious tabletop tennis battles. Each set comes with everything you need to play and you can use up to four sets to customize your deck and use your awesome ping-pong skills to battle for your country!
127048.name: Penny Arcade: Paint The Line ECG – Red Tide
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 15: Survive: Escape from Atlantis!, Trading Places, and Cardinal Quest

127049.name: Femkort
127049.description:
Swedish trick-taking game from at least early 19th century. Players are dealt five cards. Basic trick-taking rules: follow suit, go over if possible, winner of the trick leads to the next. Winner of the last trick wins the hand.

Adults used to play the game for money, nowadays the game is mostly used to teach trick-taking basics to children.

127050.name: Poker Dices
127050.description:
The hit card game "Poker" but in dice form all in a self contained plastic tray with tumblers to contain and roll the dice.

Players will be trying to get the highest scoring combination of dice, the best of which wins the round and gets points associated with their combo of dice. Rounds start off by rolling the dice up to three time during their turn. their first roll has to be done with all five dice but the second and third roll they must leave at least one but up to four dice unchanged. Players can score after their first or second roll but after the third roll they must score their dice. The ranking order of hands are the same as conventional poker. You win by having the most points at the end of a predetermined set of rounds.

127052.name: DICEcapades! Quick Play Edition
127052.description:
DICEcapades! Quick Play Edition is a smaller version of DICEcapades that can be either played in half the time as a standalone game or used as an expansion for the original game. At the start of a player's turn, he draws a card from one of the decks, then tries out perform the challenge on the card, possibly with the assistance of others. The three categories of cards are:


Actionland cards are generally physical or dexterity challenges, such as drawing a picture, stacking the dice before time runs out, or doing 1d20 jumping jacks.
Thinkingtown cards are generally memory, logic, or math exercises, such as naming a certain number of items in a category, gaining/losing a point if the product of the numbers of the dice is even or odd, or rolling letter dice to spell a person's name within thirty seconds.
Triviaville cards present trivia questions, with an opponent rolling a color die, then asking the corresponding question. (Black = reader's choice.)


The player(s) performing the challenge score one or more points (if they succeed), and the first player to score twenty points wins. (The rules suggest playing in teams, so the maximum player count could be considered twelve.)

127054.name: The Chessmaster 2100
127054.description:
From the back of the box:

"First we took The Chessmaster 2000 and added 10 Man-Years of work by our programmers and graphic artists…then we supercharged its brain with the latest, most powerful, chess-playing technology direct from the laboratories of Fidelity Electronics--the foremost manufacturer of dedicated chess computers--developers of the world's Only USCF Certified Master-Rated (2325) Chess Program!!!

The resulting triumph contains every feature that skyrocketed '2000' to the top of the charts! Stunning 2-D and 3-D graphics, a mammoth opening library (now expanded to over 150,000 positions), 'Hint,' 'Teaching' and 'Show Best Variation' modes, and levels and styles of play from 'Newcomer' to 'Grandmaster.'

Plus…The Chessmaster 2100 boasts even stronger and more varied play with unlimited game levels (from an 'easier easy' to a 'tougher tough')…triple the number of features, more and different Classic Games and greater in-depth analysis. The special 'War Room' mode even allows you to view the Board, Move List, Captured Pieces, Clocks and The Fidelity Chessmaster 2100 'Show Thinking' window all at the same time!"

127055.name: Líder (Número 48 – Julio 1995)
127055.description:
Spanish Líder Magazine Issue #48
Book Summary:

SUMARIO:

El Estado de la Afición
Clubes, Novedades nacionales e internacionales, Ranking, Communikado, Actividades, Actualidad, Cómic, Fanzines, Revistas, Agenda, Desafíos y Mercadillo.
A primera vista.
Consultorio del Orco Francis
Jornadas, campeonatos y otros culebrones veraniegos, por el Doktor Konká.
El día que se hundió Magik, por José López Jara.
Yo no llevo sello
Ice Age, por la Reina del Invierno.
Magic; La 4ta edición, por Borbin Assater (la leyenda continúa)
La Ira del Dragón, por El Mercenario.
Modulo del Señor de los Anillos
Espías de Mordor, por Miguel Ángel Vázquez.
Modulo del RuneQuest
Es Sátiro Maligno, por Antonio Martín.
Modulo de Far West
Hooka Hey, por Roberto Barciela.
Modulo de James Bond
Operación Sword, por el Superagente 86.
Modulo de Vampiro; La Mascarada
Hermanos de Sangre, por Mar Calpena.
Modulo de ¡Niños!
El secuestro, por Francisco Faranco Garea.
Modulo de Paranoia
Los cuentos del abuelo ordenador: Caperucita-R-OJA, por Rafa Cama.
Modulo de Star Wars/Traveller
El viaje de Walquiria, por Enric Grau.

127056.description:
The Battle of Greece 1940-1941 using the established Firestorm System for Flames of War. The Firestorm system is designed to be used with the Flames of War but the Game can be played as a solo game under the General's Game rules.

Firestorm Greece recreates the Battle for Greece in four turns, each with a number of battles.

TURN 1 - Emergenza G - The Italian invasion on the 28 October 1940
TURN 2 - The Greek Counter-Offensive, November to January. Saw the Greeks push into Albania
TURN 3 - Primavera - Italian Spring Offensive under the personal command of Mussolini
TURN 4 - Unternehmen Marita, the German Invasion of Greece in April.

The first three turns see the struggle of the Greek and the Italian forces on the Greek Albanian boarder while Unternehmen brings the German Blitzkrieg to Greece while the British Expeditionary force W-Force under Lt. General Sir Henry Maitland Wilson adds a little to the Greek defence.

This game is available as a free download from the Flames of War website.
127056.name: Firestorm: Greece

127057.name: Adventure 7: The Rescue of Princess Millandriell (fan expansion to HeroQuest)
127057.description:
This adventure has a very simple story line. So to make it more interesting we started the Heroes from beginning stats and built them up as the story moved along. The Oger and Giant Wolf really added a lot of excitment to the game so they were used a lot. We hope that you will have as much fun with this adventure as we did creating it.
The pages for this adventure are available to download at "Dragonkingdoms.co.uk" and yahoo's group site "HeroQuest-Adventures" for free. You do need to join the group to access the file's section where they are stored. The photo section of this site will allow you to read the story and look at the maps to see if this game is something you would like to play. Your adventure awaits!

127058.name: This Just In...!
127058.description:
A party game where players use combinations of cards to create headlines along certain topics as demanded by The Editor. Each round sees a new Editor ask for a headline based on a certain subject which can be decided upon either at random or by flipping one of the included Topic cards. By using Actions, Descriptions and Things cards, players submit a headline to the editor and hope it will catch their interest. The Editor then chooses two headlines and asks the players to summarise the stories behind them. The Editor then chooses their favourite of the two and the headline is added to a Running Order.

The Running Order acts as a scoreboard of sorts. Players will recieve points for each card they use in their headlines but also get bonuses for the positions the stories end up in at the end of the game. Every time a new headline is added to the Running Order, the Editor for that turn decides where it will be placed, bumping all other stories lower than it further down the order. If there are more than ten stories, the lowest ranked one is removed from the game scoring that player no points. At the end of the game, the lead story recieves a bonus 10 points, the second 9, the third 8, etc., all the way down to 1.

127059.name: Adventure 8: The Horror Inside the Ancient Halls of Sunca (fan expansion to HeroQuest)
127059.description:
This Adventure takes place right after the end of The Frozen Horror, so we let the Heroes keep all that they had collected from the expansion games. My Heroes really liked having the extra mercenaries, so we made them a permanent part of the team. This changed things. As Zargon I used more monsters with stronger powers, The Yeti and War Bear are great monsters. This Adventure moves along quickly and I'm sure that you are going to have a lot of fun playing it.
The pages for this adventure are available to download at "Dragonkingdoms.co.uk" and yahoo's group site "HeroQuest-Adventures" for free. You do need to join the group to access the file's section where they are stored. The photo section of this site will allow you to read the story and look at the maps to see if this game is something you would like to play. Your adventure awaits!

boardgamehonor: 2013 International Gamers Award - General Strategy: Multi-player Nominee
2013 Meeples' Choice Nominee
2013 Meeples' Choice Winner
127060.description:
Stake your fortunes in the mysterious island world of Bora Bora. Journey across islands, building huts where the resilient men and women of your tribes can settle, discovering fishing grounds and collecting shells. Send priests to the temples, and gather offerings to curry favor with the gods.

In Bora Bora, players use dice to perform a variety of actions using careful insight and tactical planning. The heart of the game is its action resolution system in which 5-7 actions are available each round, the exact number depending on the number of players. Each player rolls three dice at the start of the round, then they take turns placing one die at a time on one action. Place a high number on an action, and you'll generally get a better version of that action: more places to build, more choices of people to take, better positioning on the temple track, and so on. Place a low number and you'll get a worse action – but you'll possibly block other players from taking the action at all as in order to take an action you must place a die on it with a lower number than any die already on the action.

Three task tiles on a player's individual game board provide some direction as to what he might want to do, while god tiles allow for special actions and rule-breaking, as gods are wont to do. The player who best watches how the game develops and uses the most effective strategy will prevail.
127060.name: Bora Bora
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGA Episode 100 - Top 100 Games of All Time
Board2Death Podcast Episode 2 - Bora Bora
Bora Bora (alea / Ravensburger): Spiele-Podcast Nr. 172
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 000 (2016) – Top 25 Games
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 012 – Top 10 Publishers

Episode 21: Rise of Augustus/Geeking Out
Episode 22: Bora Bora/The Meta-Game
Episode 56 – Crash of Games Reviewapalooza Fish Frenzy, Plums & Backyard Builder's Treehouse
Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1
Episode 73 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 2
Garrett's Games 354 - Bora Bora
Garrett's Games 355 - You Suck, Tzolkin, Bora Bora, Ground Floor
Garrett's Games 357 - SdJ Speculation, Drecksau, Bora Bora, and Guildhall
Garrett's Games 474 - Bora Bora, Bruges, and Rialto
Heavy Cardboard Episode 52 – Amanda’s Top 50 & Edward’s Top 50
JTRPodcast 002 – Bora Bora vs Kingsburg vs The Voyages of Marco Polo
Low Player Count - Ep 13 - Luck in Games
Low Player Count - Ep 14 - Free Form

Podcast #083 - Top 2013 parte 3
Podcast EP10 – Top 10 jeux de société
SpieLamaCast
Strange Assembly 152 - Not Constantinople
The Good, The Board, and the Fluffy: Episode 32 “Light Games”
What Did You Play This Week Podcast Thing Week 49!! Featuring Chris and Joe from Cardboard Architects, Eric Booth, AnnaBeth and Kerensa
Wooden Cubes & Iron Soldiers: “Boardgames are lame!” Episode 14

127061.description:
Game description from the publisher:

In The Ladies of Troyes, the women make an appearance in the form of three new Character cards that you can include in your games. A new action allows players to move their guard along the ramparts in order to access one of 16 new activities outside the city. Each player is represented by a new purple die (representing the head of the family), which cannot be bought by other players. The head of the family can carry out civil, military, or religious actions — your choice!

The Ladies of Troyes also includes 27 new Activity cards and six Event cards to add still more variety to the game!
127061.name: The Ladies of Troyes
boardgamepodcastepisode: Heavy Cardboard Episode 42 – Troyes
Podcast #061 - Spiel des Jahres 2013
SpieLamaCast
The Good, The Board and The Poodle Puddle: Episode 62 “Storytelling in Games”

127062.name: Monte Caseros
127062.description:
On February 3, 1852 was the final war between the Argentine Confederation and the Empire of Brazil, which began in 1851 during the Uruguay civil war, in the great Battle of Monte Caseros!

Over 60,000 soldiers fought in one of the bloodiest battles in the history of South America... After this battle, for the first time in history, a non-European army marched on the streets of Buenos Aires...

Monte Caseros is a card game for two players whose theme is the Battle of Monte Caseros. Each player must manage their armies composed of Infantry, Cavalry and Artillery. Each player must correctly apply their strategic cards, trying to trap the enemy officers and annihilate your troops!

At each turn the player must place on the battlefield cards that represent their armies and, when appropriate, to attack the enemy army, applying their strategic cards. For the resolution of the fighting we use the military force of each cards, the strategic factor, and a combat resolution table as the best war games.

127063.name: A Cartomante
127063.description:
“A Cartomante” é um jogo voltado especialmente para o público juvenil (a partir dos 14 anos), entretanto passível de ser apreciado por outras faixas etárias por se tratar de um produto que pode ser interpretado em diversas camadas. Suas ilustrações e sua identidade visual remetem ao período que ficou conhecido como belle époque dado o fato de que o conto escrito por Machado de Assis está ambientado no final do século XIX. Os cards de maior destaque no jogo estão diretamente ligados aos arcanos maiores do Tarot de Marsella, o mais tradicional oráculo de divinação trazido para os tempos atuais e também presente no conto em questão. As figuras e personagens do conto estão representadas arquetipicamente pelo significado destes arcanos nas imagens ilustradas.

Nesse jogo você tem que proteger os seus Nobres dos ataques adversários. Para isso você tem Barreiras, Artefatos, Aliados e outros tipos de cartas.

No final o jogador que tiver mais Nobres em sua área é o vencedor.


"The Fortune Teller" is a game geared especially for teenagers (from age 14 years), however that can be enjoyed by other age groups because it is a product that can be interpreted in several layers. His illustrations and visual identity refer to the period that became known as the "belle epoque" given the fact that the short story by Machado de Assis is set in the late XIX century. The most prominent cards in the game are directly linked to the major arcana of Marseille's Tarot, the most traditional oracle of divination brought to the current times and also present the story in question. The figures in the story and characters are represented by the meaning of these archetypal images illustrated in arcane.

In these game you must protect your Nobles against the other players cards. To do that you can use Barriers, Artifacts, Allies and ohter types of cards.

At the end, the player with most Nobles at your playing area is the winner.

127064.name: ASH Poker (Auction Stud-Hold'em)
127064.description:
ASH Poker, which gets its name from being a fusion of Stud and Hold'em Poker. It is a game in the poker family, which adds auctioning off draw cards so players may fill and improve their hands. It borrows the dealer button, and large and small blinds from Texas Hold'em and also each player having their own set of cards from Stud Poker.

In the game, after the big and small blinds are set, and cards are dealt, there is a round of betting. After this, draw cards are auctioned off, with money paid to obtain draw cards put in the pot. After this, another round of betting occurs. High hand takes the pot, or high hands split the pot.

The game has a number of variants that vary the number of draw cards and rounds of draw cards per hand, and also determine whether or not there are limits on bids and bets.

127065.name: The Chessmaster 3000
127065.description:
"Chessmaster is a chess playing computer game series which is now owned and developed by Ubisoft. It is the best-selling chess franchise in history, with more than five million units sold as of 2002."

Source: Wikipedia, "Chessmaster 3000", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

boardgamehonor: 2013 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
127067.description:
With King of Tokyo: Power Up! – an expansion for the King of Tokyo base game – Included is the new monster Pandakai, a giant panda bear. After choosing a monster, each player takes the eight Evolution cards associated with that monster, shuffles those cards, and creates a personal deck. At the end of a player's turn, if she has three hearts, she draws one Evolution card and adds it to her hand; this is possible even in Tokyo (when hearts are normally useless) and even if the hearts are used for some other action, such as healing.

A player can reveal and play an Evolution card at any time. Some Evolutions are temporary, allowing a one-time bonus, while others are Permanent, such as Gigazaur's "Tail Sweep", which allows him to change one die to a 1 or 2 each turn. Each Evolution card also identifies whether a monster is a Mutant, Invader or Robot, and while not relevant for Power Up!, this species identification could come into play in future expansions.

The rules for King of Tokyo: Power Up! contain a few variants: Players start with a random Evolution in play, or draw two cards and choose the one they want, or draft a set of Evolutions prior to the start of play. However you play, the goal of the game remains the same: Score 20 points or be the last monster standing amid the rubble of what was once Tokyo.
127067.name: King of Tokyo: Power Up!
boardgamepodcastepisode: 4VP - S01E04 - Return of the JeDice
Episode Seven - "Candygram for Hitler"
MN 0022 King of Tokyo and King of New York
Podcast #23: Expansions and Submissions
The Game Pit - Episode 29: The Expanded Expansion Special

127068.name: Do Move Say
127068.description:
Do Move Say is a party game for 10 - 40 players (more if one combines decks). The game takes place standing up in a moderately open space, enough for the players to move around freely.

Do Move Say has two main layers: The Mastermind and Detective game and the Townspeople game.

The Mastermind is trying to accomplish three tasks: Disable three players, find a secret key, and pass a secret note. The Detective must stand outside of the space and determine which player is the Mastermind before the tasks are complete.

The Mastermind must complete the tasks in the midst of the Townspeople game. Each Townsperson has instructions on how to behave in the space, including two "if / then" statements and two global statements. Their behavior makes it difficult for the Detective to determine which player is the Mastermind, while also making the Mastermind's tasks challenging.

Mod cards are also available in the deck, which give one or more of the townspeople goals other than satisfying both "if / then" statements. Mods include the Doctor, who can revive disabled players, the Mimic, who copies everything he sees, and the Pamphleteer, who must distribute three notes without being detected.

The game ends once the Mastermind has completed all three tasks, the Detective has made a guess, or when time expires.

127069.name: Crustacean Multiplication Dominoes
127069.description:
A math domino game for 1-4 players.

At the beginning of a 2-4 player game, each player is dealt six hexagonal crab dominoes. Each crab holds a number between its claws, which must be matched to the equation of another crab. Each crab has a single equation on one of its three hind edges, in which one of the factors is replaced with an empty box, that must be filled with an answer number from another crab. For example, a crab holding the number, 4, could be attached to a crab with the equation, 8x[]=32, on its back.

Once the players have placed their six starting dominoes face up in front of them, the top domino of the draw pile is then placed in the center of the play area, and play begins.

On a player's turn, they first draw a new domino, placing it with the others face up in front of them, and then try to add as many of their dominoes as they can to the line of crabs. Players may also move crabs from the front of the line to the back of the line, and vice-versa, but only if they can immediately add a domino from their hand, to one of the two new positions. If a player can no longer add more dominoes to the line, their turn is over. If a player plays their last domino, they win the game.

Players may use the answer wheel to check their math at any time.

The game also comes with two solitaire variants.

127071.name: ZombieSmarts
127071.description:
From the publisher:

ZombieSmarts is the infectious question-and-answer game that features grisly facts about the histories, habits, and hungers of the living dead. Choose a card and learn how to combat a zombie invasion: What should you do if a zombie bites one of your friends? Can table salts reverse the effects of "zombification"? What is smarter—a zombie or a dog? True/False and multiple-choice cards offer macabre information on zombie films, Voodoo, re-killing, undead encounters, and many other gruesome topics.

127072.name: VampireSmarts
127072.description:
From the manufacturer:

What would happen if you were bitten by a mysterious Count? How might you repel a particularly malevolent vampire? Play alone with a clove of garlic by your side, or invite your friends for a competitive vampire-athon. VampireSmarts has the answers. Inside the mesmerizing box you’ll find a VampireTips Guide, a score pad, and 100 question and answer cards in four delicious categories.

127073.name: The War in Cuba
127073.description:
An action game based on the impending Spanish-American war.

Players shot wooden bullets at die-cut soldiers using hand-held spring-loaded cannons.

127074.name: The Philippine War
127074.description:
The last of four wargames introduced in 1898 by Parker Brothers themed around the Spanish-American War.

All four games were action based and involved the players shooting wooden bullets at die-cut soldiers using hand-held spring-loaded cannons.

Although not a commercial success, the series of four games contributed greatly to Parker Brothers image as a patriotic American company.

The first three games in the series were The War in Cuba, The Siege of Havana and The Battle of Manila.

127075.name: Auspicious Beginning
127075.description:
Introductory game for the OCMS system from Game Production Workshop. The current set is covering WW II in the European Theater of operations.

This game covers the campaign in Sicily using the rules, and components for the entire game series. Set with a scale of 15 day turns, and 17 miles to the hex, it is an operational level examination of the conduct of warfare, involving ground, air, and naval forces.

The players are the commanders of the Axis and Allied forces involved in the campaign, with the historical missions assigned to both sides.

127076.name: TetraLink
127076.description:
User Summary:

TetraLink is a game where players take turns to place counters into a 6-row, 7-column grid. In order to win, one must place four of their counters in a straight line horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

127077.name: Thirty-Six Card Trick
127077.description:
User Summary:

This game is played like any other pair matching game: to flip over pairs (18 pairs in this game) of cards (on the upper side has a picture that is shown on all the cards, and the underside has a certain picture that only appears twice in the set) such that two of the same image is shown. However, each game is timed and the cards sometimes switch places; in later levels, there are multiple swaps between each turn. There is also a limited number of times that a player can make a mistake.

127078.name: Torquing!
127078.description:
User Summary:

A player must roll a hamster around a set of increasingly challenging courses, collecting sunflower seeds on your way to the exit. There are a variety of obstacles and deadly traps that the player must evade to make it through to the finish and guide the hamster to safety.

127079.name: Transmogrify
127079.description:
User Summary:

The objective of Transmogrify is to assemble words out of letter tiles randomly generated each turn. Letters can have different values: for example X may be equal to 10 while R may be equal to 2. The values of letters depend on the language. Upon making the word in the top row and submitting it, the player will be awarded points for the tiles used plus a bonus for creativity. The word will then go to the middle row and the tiles will change colours signifying that the values have increased. All tiles will start out blue then turn to green, tanned, and finally red, with each colour change corresponding to a 2 point increase in the value of the tile. The tiles from the previous word can be used in the new word but will vanish if they are not used. Sparkling tiles are "bonus tiles" and if used will double the value of the word. They will then cease to be bonus tiles, so there is always precisely one bonus tile available to use.
Players have 10 rounds to make as many points as possible. In addition to the points for the tiles and for variety, already mentioned, there is a bonus based on the time taken.

127080.name: Vertigo 2
127080.description:
User summary:

The aim of the game is to paint all of the blue tiles purple by jumping up and down to reach each "layer" of tiles. Each level consists of a variety of obstacles to make the game more challenging as well as moving platforms, teleporters and other collectables that may be useful.

127081.name: Virogrid
127081.description:
User Summary:

The game is played on a square grid of size 7x7, 9x9 or 11x11. Each player starts with two pieces in diagonally opposite corners.
A turn consists of cloning or jumping a piece. Cloning a piece consists of selecting one of your pieces and an adjacent empty square, and creates a new piece in that empty square. Jumping consists of selecting one of your pieces and an empty square at a distance of two squares (see diagram); the piece moves to the selected square, leaving the one it was in empty. Any opposing pieces adjacent to, respectively, the new or jumped piece are captured and change sides.

A player who has a legal move on their turn must move: failure to do so before time runs out is considered a resignation. It is possible to get a situation where only one player has legal moves. If at the start of a player's turn they have no legal moves the game automatically fills the remaining spaces with pieces of the other player.

The game is won by capturing all of the opponent's pieces or by having the most pieces when the board is full. As the boards all have an odd number of squares a draw is possible only by agreement.

127082.name: Wizard Run
127082.description:
User Summary:

In Wizard Run, the player (Alice the Apprentice) must battle hordes of enemies with the wand that her master left her before she was kidnapped. She shoots stars out of the wand and at the end of every level she must face a boss to progress to the next level.

127083.name: Zombie Dawn
127083.description:
User Summary:

Players take the role of a Zombie Overlord, who commands zombies to go around and assimilate humans, turning them into zombies as well.

127084.name: Zombie Dawn Multiplayer: Fight of the Living Dead
127084.description:
User Summary:

In this sequel to the original zombie dawn game, you, the zombie overlord have joined in the fight with other overlords to compete for the increasingly rare resource: Humans. Who will be the victor?

127085.name: Geographical Lotto
127085.description:
Statler made a version of "Geographical Lotto" with USA map cards and cities. Playthings Limited made essentially the same game for Canadian cards and cities. It is not known if Playthings and Statler were somehow connected.

The game is basically a bingo game whereby the player have cards which they are trying to fill. The call are made by blindly drawing a city card which is then called out. Each card has twelve cities. The winner is the player who fills his card first.

Contents:

Geographic cards for each player with 15 cities
City cards which to draw & call

127086.name: Crazy Tower
127086.description:
The excitement is building with the Crazy Tower! Use the 10 bamboo discs, 19 bamboo pillars and 2 balance figures to stack your tower higher and higher, but be careful, or it all might come crashing down! It takes nerves of steel and a steady hand to make crazy towers.

In his turn player places a game-piece to tower and be careful not to collapse the tower and score minus points.

The player with the most points wins the game.

127087.name: Nereid (Issue 8 - Jul/Aug 1997)
127087.description:
Spanish Nereid Magazine Issue #8
Book Summary:

SUMARIO:

EDITORIAL
MAS ALLA DE LAS FRONTERAS
El Kenku, Nueva categoría (4ta parte), por Dr. Morbius.
Especial Ladrones; Nuevas pericias y kits para asesinos, por Marc Torra.
Especial Ladrones; Los Filtros, por Marc Torra.
TIME LORDS
Un nuevo concepto de vacaciones.
LA BIBLIOTECA DE ASTINUS
Sección de Novedades.
El juego del trimestre, por Salvador Rosselló y Juan José Peña.
EL GRIMORIO DEL HECHIZERO
Nuevos conjuros de Mago, por Marc Torra y David Reboll.
EL BESTIARIO DE LUMER SHA’ROT
Nuevos monstruos para AD&D, por Iñigo Artundo, Josu Arratibel y demás colaboradores de Pamplona.
EL PODER DE LA FE
Nuevos conjuros de sacerdote, por Josu Arratibel y Juan José Peña.

LA CIUDAD DE ZARRASHMIR
Suplemento de AD&D 2da edición; El Barrio Bárbaro, por Marc Torra.
MODULO AD&D
La Mano de Shadar, ambientando en Zarrashmir (Aventura para personajes de nivel 8-9), por Marc Torra.
EL PNJ
Shadar, por Marc Torra.
ORA:CLE. AREA DE STARS!
Artículo sobre el juego Stars! De la BBS ORA:CLE, por Juan José Peña.
RELATO
El Abrazo, por Aurora Olver Martín.
MODULO DE RAGNAROCK (2da Edición)
