The escorts of a light square are the square immediately in front of it and the square immediately to the left of it.

The escorts of a dark square are the square immediately behind it and the square immediately to the right of it.


Play

Black plays first, then turns alternate. On his turn, a player must place one stone of his color on an empty point.

After a placement, if the two escorts of one or more squares are occupied by friendly stones and said squares aren't occupied by friendly stones yet, the player must place a stone of his color on each one of them, removing, where appropriate, any enemy stones already placed there. Note that some squares on the edge of the board have only one escort or no escorts at all. These squares are not affected by this rule.

The game is won by the player who completes a chain of orthogonally adjacent stones of his color touching the two opposite board edges of his color. Draws are not possible.


Pie rule

The pie rule is used in order to make the game fair. This means that White will have the option, on his first turn only, to change sides instead of making a regular move.


Notes

Two like-colored, diagonally adjacent stones parallel to the NE-SW diagonal are always connected through a common neighbor in Brique, so, as in Hex, each square has actually six neighbours, and the board behaves like a rhombus, with one diagonal twice as shorter as the other. Needless to say, however, Brique is not isomorphic to Hex.

127190.name: Sesame Street Mother Goose Audio Card Game
127190.description:
This is a simple card game for preschool children with a cute gimmick... the package includes a cassette tape of the Sesame Street characters reading classic nursery rhymes.

Cards representing these nursery rhymes are distributed among the players. When the matching fairy tale (Humpty Dumpty, Jack Sprat, Old Mother Hubbard, etc.) is read by a character the kid holding that card tosses it away.

The children gain and lose cards during a session because the spinner is twirled when the stories appear on the tape. The player holding the Mother Goose card at the end of the game is declared the winner.

There are no decisions to be made and there is no strategy. This is a basic introduction to card games for three year old kids.

Includes 12 cards, spinner, cassette tape, plastic card holder,
and the rules.

Designed for 2-4 players.

127191.name: Grey Worlds (Volume 1, Issue 1 - Jun 1993)
rpgissuearticle: Grey Law - Writers' and Artists' Guidelines
127191.description:
Vol. I, No. 1

Cover Artist: Angus McBride

User Summary:
House Magazine for Iron Crown Enterprises; this issue covers Optional, Spell and Professional Laws for Rolemaster

127192.description:
A pack of 14 promo cards that combine the Kickstarter exclusives into their "common" form for public release. All cards were published in either the K-Pack or Distinguished Service Pack. The effects are the same but the titles have been changed so that both copies of the cards can be in play.

From the K-Pack:
Medal for War (Pledge Ribbon - Award)
Médaille Commémorative (Victory Ribbon - Award)
General Service Medal (Campaign Ribbon - Award)
Leather Jerkin (K-Gun - Regular Item)
Candy Bars (K-Rations - Regular Item)
Supply Officer (Supporter - Unique Specialist)

From the DSP:
Ordre de la Libération (Voluntary Service Medal - Award)
Military Fighter's Cross (Good Conduct Medal - Award)
Long Service and Good Conduct Medal (Order of the Bath - Award)
Cigar (Cigarette - Regular Item)
Religious Pin (Sweetheart Pin - Regular Item)
Orange Flare (Field Telephone - Regular Item)
Command Car (Personnel Carrier - Vehicle)
Anschluss Medal (Sports Badge - Decoration)
127192.name: D-Day Dice: Commission Pack

127193.name: Paradise Quest
127193.description:
User Summary:

Restore a devastated tropical island by collecting resources and magical artifacts in match-3 game play.

In a match-3 game, you move one tile at a time in a field of tiles to match 3 or more tiles, eliminating those tiles from the grid and scoring them. Paradise Quest spices up the standard match-3 gameplay with a moving field that is larger than the screen area; as you match tiles, you must in the direction of your last match. Paradise Quest also features powerups that you can use for special effects, like using Lightning to clear a 3x3 block of tiles.

The game includes wifi/Bluetooth competitive or cooperative play. However, when playing cooperatively only the host of the game advances in the story mode.

127194.name: Curse of Crosskey
127194.description:
From the front cover:

The Western Star, sailing on a clear sea, is suddenly caught in a mysterious storm appearing out of the blue. Skies darken as fierce wind and driving rain lash at the ship, sending it crashing upon the shore of Crosskey Island. Those fortunate souls that survive must find rescue before their supply of food and water run out. Some of the passengers seem to have plans of their own. Will the "Curse of Crosskey" finally be revealed?

127195.name: Robot Unicorn Attack: Heavy Metal
127195.description:
Robot Unicorn Attack - Heavy Metal is the second in the Robot Unicorn Attack series of games. Based on the original Robot Unicorn Attack, this follow-up replaces the cutesy theme of the first game with METAL. The game's music is 'Battlefield' by Blind Guardian.

Enter a world of darkness, where rainbows are replaced by fire and brimstone, skillfully navigating the platforms that stretch unending through the deepest depths of the underworld. Collect imps as you go, leaping majestically from island to island and dashing through the perilous pentagrams that block your way. You have but three tries. Failure is inevitable.

Source: The Publisher Website.

127196.name: NEMESIS Go Master
127196.description:
About this game's author:

"He wrote a Go program for the IBM-PC in the early 80's called NEMESIS Go Master, which became the first Go program to be released in Japan (as Taikyoku Igo)."

Source: Wikipedia, "Bruce Wilcox", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127197.name: GO
127197.description:
From the game box:

"GO for the Macintosh lets you:
- learn the fundamentals of the game by playing against the computer, or against your friends
- save and replay published games
- learn from famous games
- choose among different size boards in 2D and 3D
- play matches via modem

Invented in China some 4000 years ago, the rules are extremely simple, yet the strategic choices almost infinite... GO. The Ultimate Game of Strategy."

127198.description:
I think I am going crazy. It may be that all I have ever written you is a dream or madness. It was bad enough before, but this time it is too much. They talked to me last night - talked in that cursed buzzing voice and told me things that I dare not repeat to you...

Vermont Horror is an unofficial fan-created expansion to Arkham Horror, based on the H.P. Lovecraft story 'The Whisperer in Darkness'. It introduces several new game concepts to the Arkham Horror Series, including a Prequel stage of the game.

Vermont is home to the Mi-go, a race of aliens from Yuggoth intent on plundering the earth of its natural resources, extracting valuable minerals from parallel planes underneath the earth. Whilst digging down to these inter-dimensional portals the Mi-go are inadvertently disturbing ancient seals buried deep in the ground. These eons old seals are holding the Ancient Ones at bay and as they become disturbed it increases the chances of the Old One stirring from its slumber.

Vermont Horror also adds one new Herald, a unique deck of Prequel events, over 30 new monster markers, plenty of new encounters from Townshend to the Dark Mountains, a deck of unique Mi-go technology to be harnessed and an expansion board featuring the locality of Vermont.
127198.name: Vermont Horror Expansion (fan expansion for Arkham Horror)

127199.name: Richtig wild
127199.description:
Where does the Matter of the vulture? With these and many other questions on the topics of animals, plants and their habitats are engaged in this exciting trivia game.

There are 2 questions in each card with 3 answers for each questions. The winner is whoever can answer most questions correctly and thus can collect the most cards.
If the current player answers incorrectly the next player may risk with one of his collected card to answer it.

Contents:

32 large format cards with color photos

127200.name: Natur macht erfinderisch
127200.description:
Very often spectacular scientific inventions are based upon nature - the aeroplane, roof tiles, or the newest thing, the "lotus effect" - a dirt-rejecting ability that now is used for sinks. With the simple means of a dice/movement game those connection between nature and science are explored and explained. Players try to find as many logical connections between nature and science as possible, the board parcours has 5 kinds of spaces, which require different forms of problem solving to find a solution. Players roll the die, advance their pawn and solve the problem of the space they land on. For a correct solution players receive a bionic-chip, who has collected five of them, wins the game.

Would you know what a fly and a bicycle have in common? The gear shift in a bicycle was devised from the fly's shoulder joint.

127201.name: Guerra aereo-navale
127201.description: The title of this wargame for kids, published in Italy in 1940, means "Air-Naval War". Wooden pieces on cardboard board, with one path for a blue party and one for the red one. Airplanes, ships and tanks advance into enemy territory to conquest and eliminate fortresses, factories, oil resrves, bridges, stations, ammunition supplies and so on. Submarines and assault light ships can intervene to eliminate enemy ships. Simple game with a very actual theme for the moment it was released (on June 10th, 1940, Italy enters World War 2).

127202.name: Under Siege
127202.description:
Under Siege is an abstract game played on a circular board by 2 players. One player attempts to move his King piece from the center and completely off the board. The other player attempts to capture the King piece.

Turn based play where pieces move one space per move and capture opposing pieces by moving onto the space occupied by the piece being attacked.

Special moves apply to the larger pieces, namely being able to 'Vault' other pieces of the same team effectively allowing movement of two spaces under specific circumstances.

The King piece cannot capture opposing pieces.

The numbers on each side are uneven, the 'Peasants' have 16 pieces (8 smaller, 8 Larger) while the 'Royalty' have the King and 12 pieces (8 smaller, 4 Larger). This is to balance the fact that the 'Peasant' pieces start the game spread completely around the board, while the 'Royal' pieces are grouped together in the center.

127203.description:
Game description form the publisher:

Quest: Zeit der Helden - Wolfsjagd, the first thematic extension for Quest: Zeit der Helden - Angriff der Orks, offers an exciting new adventure and provides the Questmaster with many other figures of his own stories. This time, the heroes fall into the clutches of a terrible werewolf – and must keep themselves from succumbing to the werewolf's curse.

A new heroine supports the players in pursuit of the beast, as well as ten wolves and ten robbers, the most villains ever in a Quest game! Luckily, the heroes have access to new magic items specifically for hunting werewolves.

The strength of both the heroes and the Questmaster will continue to grow with each quest, the players continuing with their heroes from the original game. This personal development across multiple games will continue in future expansions.
127203.name: Quest: Zeit der Helden – Wolfsjagd

127204.name: ParisSmarts
127204.description:
From the manufacturer:

Become the Parisan expert with this question and answer game about one of the most romantice cities in the world, Paris. Filled with tons of information and guarateed to teach while you play, it's a great item for the traveler in all of us. Includes 60 questions, a Guide and a Scorepad in a sturdy flip top box.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Kinderspielexperten "5-to-9-year-olds" Nominee
127206.description:
A first introduction to calculations for very young children. The centerpiece of the game is a plastic octopus with two arms stretched out. Around it, fishes of various values (and weights) are placed. The active player picks a large bundle of fish and hangs it on one of the arms, then tries to find several individual fishes for the other arm. If successful, octopus Mr. Tom looks straight and the arms are balanced, if not, it is losing focus and balance.
In the two player version, one child can pick one side and let the other player make the calculations for getting the octopus back into its balance.
127206.name: Mr. Tom

127207.name: Pinch It!
127207.description:
Pinch It! is a simple dice game based primarily on luck. The game was intriguing since it was played using a 4x4 grid of pegs. The board is divided into four quadrants each having a different color. Within each quadrant is a 2x2 grid of pegs.

The die used is a six sided die with special markings which control the action of the player.


2 Blank faces – The player’s turn is over and the die is passed to the next player.



Hollow Square – The player discards one of his own pegs.



Hollow Triangle – The player may take a peg from any player of his choice and discard it.



Solid Square – The player may replace one of his empty peg holes with a discarded peg. If he doesn’t have any empty hole, then his turn is finished.



Solid Square and Solid Triangle - The player may replace one of his empty peg holes with a peg from any player of his choice. If he doesn’t have any empty hole, then his turn is finished.


The objective is to have the last peg on the board.

127208.name: Bluffjack
127208.description:
Bluffjack is a hybrid of poker and blackjack. It borrows the bluffing and betting against other players from poker, and the trying to get close to 21 without going over from Blackjack (21).

In the game, players are dealt one card face down, and one card face up, and players wager. Then players get cards, and try to get close to 21. After this players will engage in another round of betting.

Bluffjack offers the chance for players to win if a player went over 21 and everyone else folded. However, if all players remaining players went over 21, everyone loses, and their best are set aside.

127209.name: Book of the Empress
127209.description:
From the Back Cover

The Power of the Empress

The Champions Universe features many deadly supervillains, but perhaps the most dangerous of them all is Istvath V'han,Empress of a Billion Dimensions. Rule of an empire that encompasses much of the Multiverse, she now has her sights set on the grandest prize of all Champions Universe Earth!

The Book of the Empress is your guide to everything about Istvath V'han. It features:


a history of the Empress, from her earliest days conquering single planets up to her recent attempts to invade Earth's dimension.



an in-depth look at the Empress herself -- her powers, motivations, and resources.



a review of the Imperial Legions -- the might V'hanian military -- including its regular soldiers, superhuman soldiers, weapons, and vehicles.



a description of the Multiverse of the Champions Universe, including its nature, its structure, and numerous example dimensions.



a description of the V'hanian Empire itself, including V'han's regents and viceroys, the imperial bureaucracy, the Imperial Security Force, how she plans and executes the conquest of a dimension, and her current plans for Earth.



suggestions on how to use Istvatha V'han in your campaign including plot seeds.



a discussion of dimensional campaigning, including a Random Dimension Generator the Gm can use to quickly create new dimensions.


So tell your heroes to get ready -- it's time for them to confront the dimension conquering power of Istvatha V'han.

127210.name: Monster of the Week
rpghonor: 2012 Indie RPG Award - Best Support - Runner-Up
2012 Indie RPG Award - Game of the Year - Runner-Up
2013 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
127210.description:
From the publisher's website:

There are monsters out there. Most people don't believe in them, but they're real. Mostly, when someone finds out that monsters are real, that's just before they die.

But some people are mean enough, smart enough, crazy enough, or hurt enough, that they live. And some of those people go and hunt down more.

That's who you are – someone who decided to go on a crusade against the evil critters that are scurrying around out there.

It could be that you make a stand and defend your hometown from everything evil that comes there.

It could be you take to the road and go find them.

It could be you have magic powers that help out.

It could be that your name came up in prophecies thousands of years ago.

The one sure thing is you aren't gonna go back to your old, safe life.
rpgpodcastepisode: Actual Play: Monster of the Week, the Conclusion!
Monster of the Week: Good Stories for Nightmares
Monster of the Week: The Lombardi School 11

127211.name: The Divine
rpgseries: Monster of the Week Hunter Playbook
127211.description:
From the introduction:

I am the Light, the Sword.

I am sent to defend the meek from Darkness.

All Evil fears me, for I am its end.

A Monster of the Week hunter playbook.

127212.name: The Hard Case
rpgseries: Monster of the Week Hunter Playbook
127212.description:
From the introduction:

I've fought anything normal that can be fought, and I've won. Monsters need a beatdown, and there ain't nobody can give 'em the thrashing I can. So stand back, I got this.

A Monster of the Week hunter playbook.

127213.name: The Snoop
rpgseries: Monster of the Week Hunter Playbook
127213.description:
From the introduction:

The monsters have kept themselves from sight, but they're out there and I'm going to find them. Find them and record them. Then the evidence will be incontrovertible, and I will be the one who did it. I'm going to be a superstar one day, you mark my words! Hey... did you just feel a chill? Quick! Turn on the infrared cameras!

A Monster of the Week hunter playbook.

127214.name: The Summoned
rpgseries: Monster of the Week Hunter Playbook
127214.description:
From the introduction:

I was called here. Don’t know why. Don’t know where from.
But I got this sense: like there’s a destiny waiting for me. I think - real soon - we’re gonna find out why I was called.
But I have this feeling it’s for something bad. Real bad.

A Monster of the Week hunter playbook.

127215.name: Bach's Seats
127215.description:
You are a boxer. You don't punch anybody; you work in a box making boxes for Bach's Boxes. The Bach family has made big bucks in the box business. They live in luxury based on the hard work of all their employees. It's a dreary job with no advancement, but the job has one perk: The Bach's love entertainment. They buy the best tickets for every ball game, every play, every movie, every concert, every opera, and absolutely every show in town. They buy so many tickets that they always have tickets they can't use, which they give to the workers. Your objective is to schmooze the other employees to score tickets so you can party with your friends. The bigger the party, the more your friends will think of you. That's important, because right now your friends think of you as someone who makes minimum wage sitting in a box making boxes.

Players have employee cards and office cards. First everyone simultaneously chooses and reveals an employee, then everyone simultaneously selects and reveals an office. The employees go to the office where they were assigned. Employees beat employees via a rock-paper-scissor mechanism. The winning employee scores tickets for the player.

boardgamecompilation: Yggdrasil Second Edition with Asgard Expansion
127216.description:
In Yggdrasil: Asgard, an expansion for Yggdrasil, each God can go into a Trance for one action. Once in a Trance, a God can neither fight in Asgard nor use his usual power – but all the Gods, including the one in Trance, receive a Trance power. Two examples of Trance powers: the Gods can discard the vikings' souls after rolling the die in combat, or they automatically remove five Fire giants from the bag of their choice while doing an action in the Kingdom of Fire. For one action, the entranced God can leave the Trance, at which point he recovers his usual power and can fight again.

Yggdrasil: Asgard contains twelve double-sided God tiles, with a God's usual power on one side and the Trance power on the other. To change a God's state, the player simply flips the tile. The Gods included in this expansion are:


Six from the base game: Odin, Tyr, Thor, Frey, Freyja, and Heimdall
Two from the promotional cards: Frigg and Vidar
Four new Gods: Magni, Sif, Njord and Idunn
127216.name: Yggdrasil: Asgard

127217.description: Wiraqocha: The Way of the Feathered Serpent is a small expansion that consists of six tiles, four cards, 2 tokens, 4 player screens, new stickers and rules, with the materials introducing new ways of playing Wiraqocha.
127217.name: Wiraqocha: The Way of the Feathered Serpent

127218.description: The small expansion West Riding Revisited: Free Mergers brings more freedom to the compact West Riding Revisited game.
127218.name: West Riding Revisited: Free Mergers

127219.name: Ironclaw: Book of Jade
127219.description:
From the back of the PDF


Where Heaven and Earth meet is the Middle Kingdom

Enter the land of Zhongguo, where Dragons, Qilings, and other creatures of legend live among Cats, Rats, Dogs and dozens of other race... Where Celestial Bureaucracy governs not only the Noble Houses of Earth, but also the Heaven Court and even weather itself... Where evil lurks in forgotten places, and ambition stirs in the hearts of the greedy and wrathful... Where masters of the mystic martial arts make impossible feats look effortless... Where wizards conjure forth balls of fire, bolts of lightning, thunderstorms, or even change fate itself... Where adventure can be found from the uncharted wilderness, to the Forbidden city of Mâjing, and all places in between.

The Book of Jade expands your IRONCLAW campaign with new lands for adventure, new species and careers, new martial arts, and new magic.

You will need the IRONCLAW Player's Book or the Omnibus to play this game.

127220.description:
Game description from the publisher:

West Riding Revisited: Hull & Barnsley brings an interesting new train line to West Riding Revisited.
127220.name: West Riding Revisited: Hull & Barnsley

127221.name: Bridge Building & Cross Over
127221.description:
A pair of abstract games, made cheaply and aimed at children. Cross Over is a proper game, even adults will like it, but the rules for the Bridge Building game are completely indecipherable. So, I will only describe the Cross Over game.

Each player starts at opposite corners on the board. The object is to get one piece on to the opponents back corner (marked with an X on the board).

A die dictates distance of movement and you can only move a piece either horizentally or diagonally. It would appear that you cannot change direction within the move. If you land on an opponent's piece, that piece is removed from the board. If a person has lost pieces and rolls a 6, he can bring on one of the lost pieces but only within his start field.

The game is magnetic with the two boards forming the top and bottom of a case and the pieces can be stored within that case.

127222.description:
Game description from the publisher:

SNCF: The Netherlands extends the SNCF system to include bankruptcy and receivership.
127222.name: SNCF: The Netherlands

127223.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Colorado Midland: Mayors brings stakeholders into play in Colorado Midland.
127223.name: Colorado Midland: Mayors

127224.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Age of Steam: Hungary is both as ruinous and as cooperative as the "Rust Belt" game board from Age of Steam.
127224.name: Age of Steam Expansion: Hungary

127225.name: Hell on Earth: Reloaded
127225.description:
Taken from the Pinnacle Website:


The end isn’t nigh—it’s past! Welcome to Hell on Earth Reloaded, the dark future of the strange past of Deadlands.

The year is 2097, but the future is not our own. The long Cold War between the United and Confederate States of America finally came to an end—in world-wide hellfire. The rain of ghost rock bombs shattered most anything man could call civilization, cracked the space between this world and the next wide open, and birthed a true Hell on Earth.

But that was 16 years ago, and we’ve done the one thing we’re pretty good at—survive in spite of ourselves. Sure, some folks have some extra limbs, you’re likely to get killed for the scraps in your pocket, and everything east of the Mississippi is overrun with a crazed army of undead, but what other option do you have?

Join us in this dark future, where what remains cries out for new heroes while hiding from old—even ancient—villains. Has your body been wracked by the constant radiation exposure, or have you learned to channel the lingering power of the atom to your will? Remake the world as you wish. Hell, you can’t make it any worse…

127226.name: QuizDetektiv: Dinosaurier
127226.description:
A quiz game aimed at children. The questions are all related to the theme, in this case, dinosaurs. You are given three possible answers and so if you don't know, you can have fun guessing.

The player who answers the most questions correctly, wins. As a little extra, each player can check their score against a table and will be rated as:
A Super-Meister-Quizdetectiv, or;
A Meister Quizdetectiv, or;
A Quizdetectiv, or:
A Hilfs-Quizdetectiv

127227.description:
In the game CO₂, each player is the CEO of an energy company responding to government requests for new, green power plants. The goal is to stop the increase of pollution, while meeting the rising demand for sustainable energy — and of course profiting from doing so. You will need enough expertise, money, and resources to build these clean power plants. Energy summits will promote global awareness, and allow companies to share a little of their expertise, while learning still more from others.

The Arctic is especially vulnerable to the effects of global warming, as has become apparent in the melting sea ice in recent years. Climate models predict much greater warming in the Arctic than the global average.

"CO₂: Promo Expansion Arctic" adds the arctic's area in game, a global Event - The Arctic Melts, and The Arctic Company Goal card.

By the way, if the pollution isn't stopped, it's game over for all of us.
127227.name: CO₂: The Arctic Expansion

127228.name: Build'em Up Barrels
127228.description:
Another balancing game that followed in the Tsunami named Jenga.

In this game, players get to stack plastic barrels and planks on a slowly rotating base against the clock.

The pile will tumble when the base stops rotating and you score for how much you had constructed before the collapse.

The one player game is basically "See if you can beat your best score" type of thing. Much better as a competitive game.

Battery operated.

127229.name: 1830 Cardgame
127229.description:
1830 Cardgame is an economic slugfest by the designer of railroad games like Lokomotive Werks and Union vs. Central, and your goal is to have the most money on hand at game's end. Each turn you draw a card from one of three face-up cards, then perform one of four actions:


Buy a share, paying the cost.
Buy a train, which (strangely) costs nothing.
Build a station.
Pay dividends.


Each share is worth the number of stations a company has that have trains to service them. As in 1830: Railways & Robber Barons, an inspiration for this design, trains must be purchased in order; players are limited in the number of trains they can own. The game ends after all shares have been purchased, all "8" trains have been acquired, or twelve dividend payouts have been made.

Released as part of the 2012 Essen package from Winsome.

127230.name: Cue-Off
127230.description:
From the rules booklet: "A minature game (like) snooker with a difference. A game designed for 2-4 players from 8yrs to adult. A game as thoughtful as chess played with the tenacity of skillful snooker players."

Game seems to be about shaking some dice and moving the cue ball until it strikes another ball. The rules are rather vague about what happens when a ball strikes multiple balls, either at the same time or in a chain reaction.

Contains:

Score Sheets
Pencils
Dice Cue Off Cards
Rules book and 24 balls

127231.name: Toughman Contest
127231.description:
User Summary

Toughman Contest is an international boxing tournament game published by Electronic Arts in 1995 for the Genesis and the 32X. Both versions have four regions for competition with their own pools of fighters. There are 24 total pugilists in the game, divided among the different regions. The 32X version features some graphical enhancements and slightly more responsive controls, but is otherwise the same game.

127232.name: Evander Holyfield's "Real Deal" Boxing
127232.description:
User Summary

Evander Holyfield's "Real Deal" Boxing was a Sega Genesis exclusive boxing game that was released worldwide in 1992.

127233.name: The Library of Altinum
127233.description:
From Introduction:

The Library of Altinum is an adventure written for Dungeons and Dragons and employs its 3rd Edition rules and d20 game system. It is designed for a party comprising 4-6 characters of 3rd to 5th level, ideally a combined total of 18-20 levels of experience, with a good mix of character classes. It can be played as an independent expedition or can be fitted into your own campaign world setting.

The adventure is a challenging one. It is advised that the Dungeon Master take time to read through the adventure before running it in order to become familiar with the setting and the encounters that the party will face. The Dungeon Master may want to adjust the numbers of monsters prior to starting the adventure to suit the size and strength of the adventuring party.

The adventure first appeared in the Red Giant (Volume 1, Number 2 - 1990) and has been revised and rewritten for use with Wizards of the Coast d20 Game System.

127234.name: The Tomb of Lady Gasping
127234.description:
From Introduction:

The Tomb of Lady Gasping is designed to be an extremely difficult and testing challenge for even the most experienced players. Unless the party work together as a team, it is unlikely that they will survive the ordeal. Challenges will be met that they may never have had to deal with, so lateral thinking and an imaginative approach is required. It is suggested that the party comprise at least six characters of 9th-12th level, with a good mix of character classes and at least three strong fighter-types (ideally a combined total of 60 levels of experience).

The adventure is a challenging one. It is advised that the Dungeon Master take time to read through the adventure before running it in order to become familiar with the setting and the encounters that the party will face. The Dungeon Master may want to adjust the numbers of monsters prior to starting the adventure to suit the size and strength of the adventuring party.

The Tomb of Lady Gasping adventure is set within its own campaign world. The main settlement in the region is the city of Wrak, situated on the eastern coast at the mouth of the River Zab. The Tomb lies in the cold wastes of Harune to the north of Wrak, in an old tin mining region.

It is up to you whether you use the adventure setting, or whether you substitute the place names in the adventure with those of your own world. For example, Wrak city, from which the adventurers start, could be any large city in your own campaign world, while the northern wastes could be any cold and barren region.

127235.name: Line of Fire (SMS)
videogameversion: North American Sega Master System edition
127235.description:
User Summary

Line of Fire puts you in the action as a commando behind enemy lines who captuores a top-secret piece of military hardware. Now in the overhead view, you must move forward and destroy a large number of enemy troops to escape with your prize. This game should not be confused with the light-gun shooter by the same name.

127236.name: Game Geek (Issue 31- Jul 2012)
127236.description:
From the table of contents


Musing of the Avalon Stogie
Behind the Game, 40 K
Coral Throne Interlude IX
GROMM
Heroes Wear Masks - Doctor Death
Ruby Red
Mark's Musings
New Stuff for SOG
Artist Spotlight
Avalon Pathfinder
Wired Issue #4
Nova Blast
Avalon Models
Reviews
What's New
Arcana

127237.name: HorseSmarts
127237.description:
From the manufacturer:

Challenge your friends and family with this question and answer game made especially for horse enthusiasts everywhere. Complete with 100 questions covering breeds, health, history and work and play, this game will teach as you play by yourself, with multiple players or even in teams.

127238.name: YogaSmarts
127238.description:
From the manufacturer:

Challenge your friends, family and other yoga enthusiasts with this question and answer game made especially for the zen at heart. Complete with 100 questions covering styles, poses, stretches and the language of yogs, this game will teach as you play by yourself, with multiple players or even in teams.

127239.name: Classic RockSmarts
127239.description:
From the manufacturer:

Challenge your friends, family, band members, anyone with this question and answer game made especially for classic rockers everywhere. Complete with 100 questions covering rock stars, concerts, movies and groups, this game will teach as you play by yourself, with multiple players or even in teams.

127240.name: Promethean: The Created Demo
127240.description:
From publisher blurb:

Promethean: The Created is a new game set in the World of Darkness, featuring a whole new type of character for players, inspired by the classic Frankenstein monster and the worldwide myths of Golems. Prometheans are soulless corpses animated by a mysterious, alchemical force — the Divine Fire stolen from the gods. Their hideousness forces humans, animals, and even nature itself to reject them on an instinctual level. They wander the dark places of the world, seeking what their creators denied them: humanity.

127241.name: Promethean: The Created Promo
127241.description:
From publisher blurb:

It’s Alive!

This free booklet introduces you to those shadowy figures inhabiting the World of Darkness known as Prometheans.

A storytelling game of stolen lives.

This is the first time that White Wolf has explored the traditional horror genre of created monsters — characters who from the outset stand apart from the rest of society, isolated.

Only able to pretend at emotions and being human, what they want most in the world is to have a soul.

127242.description:
Additional sets of player tiles in blue and green to expand the base "For The Win" game (2 players) to a maximum of 4 players.

This was a special item for Kickstarter project backers. However, TMG reserved the right to distribute some additional copies of this expansion as promos.
127242.name: For The Win: 3-4 Player Expansion

127243.name: Drug Wars
127243.description:
User Summary

Drug Wars is a light-gun game which utilizes full-motion video footage. In the game, you are a government agent moving up the drug enforcement ladder, distinguishing yourself in small-town raids and building up to big city busts.

127244.name: Call to Assembly (Issue 3 - Jun 2012)
rpgissuearticle: Another Doctor for Marvel Heroic Roleplaying
Doctor Who in Marvel Heroic Roleplaying
My Mom Plays Pathfinder, Everybody Dies
What If Each Setting Had Its Own Alignments?
127244.description:
From the introduction

The Gamer Assembly is an online community of enthusiasts dedicated to making tabletop RPGs more fun and easier to play for players and GMs.

In the Call to Assembly, we assemble the best articles published in the past two months from around the web into one PDF, hearkening back to the beloved paper RPG magazines and fanzines of the 1970's, 1980's, and 1990's.

This issue covers material published in April and May 2012.

127245.name: Agile Warrior: F-111X
127245.description:
Box Description:

Get something straight right now.

This ain't no by-the-books, academy-trained flight sim. This is fast and furious, high speed, high stakes, surface-to-air arcade combat action. Strap into the most advanced multi-role fighter craft around--the kind developed from top-secret military design specs with cutting-edge Thrust Vectoring technology--and blast off into a world of sky-ripping, ground-shaking, adrenaline-pumping battles.

Your objective is simple: eliminate anything and everything that poses a threat to our national security. Use stealth technology, precision-guided munitions and tactical radar to destroy the enemy on land, at sea and in the air. No rules. No prisoners. Just you-against-them combat where only one can win.

Features:

-Cutting-edge graphics technology allows you to push the envelope even further when teamed with 3-D graphics accelerator boards.

-Jam through immersive action in explosive real-time, unlimited access, 3-D textured battle environments.

-Fight in hundreds of killer scenarios throughout 10 highly unpredictable missions, featuring surgical strikes, stealth missions and nuclear standoff in some of the world's most volatile hotspots.

-State-of-the-art weapons including: TV-Guided Maverick Missiles, AIM-120 AMRAAM air-to-air missiles, Fuel Air Munitions, Napalm, your trusty 30mm Vulcan Cannon and more.

-Full-motion video pumped up with heart-racing soundtrack and deadly effects.

127246.name: Charlotte's Web: Wilbur And Friends
127246.description:
Box Description:

Join Wilbur and his friends in the Zuckerman's Barn

Explore the Zuckerman's barn through nine games featuring lovable characters from Charlotte's Web the Nickelodeon Movies/Walden Media/Paramount Pictures film. The games range from "Wilbur's Bale Out", an addictive puzzle game, to "Charlotte's Web" an obstacle challenge that incorporates spelling into an interactive experience and much more. In addition you will have the chance to pet, feed and care for Wilbur in an engaging petting pen mode.

127247.name: Into the Hive
127247.description:
From publisher blurb:

Into the Hive is a creepy, alien horror themed hunt through the vile hive of the externals. It pits a determined party of North American Union (NAU) soldiers against a vile host of flux horrors.

We've teamed up with Skeleton Key Games and tailored Into the Hive, to fit perfectly with SKG's e-Adventure Tiles: Hives product. If you pick up SKG's PDF, you have a ready-made map for this encounter – and we show you how to build the map inside. All the rules and background information you need to play are also right inside the pdf. We give you the complete scenario setup, the breakdown of the forces, counters for all of the characters and creatures you'll be using and more.

So grab your dice, grab your friends and get your Untold Encounter on - TONIGHT!

127248.name: Lawnmower Racing Mania 2007
127248.description:
Box Description:

Do you have the mowtivation?

Can you cut it?

-Hang on for dear life! Realistic physics lets you take it to the edge.

-Upgrade and customize your tractor into a lean, mean, mowing machine.

-No suspension makes for a wild ride! Lean your body to keep from flipping over.

-Race a circuit of 18 exciting tracks and collect valuable bragging rights.

127249.name: Steamfunk
127249.description:
From publisher blurb:

Imagine if all the most interesting parts of the 1800s were slammed together. Early industrialism blends with Gilded Age monopolies. H.G. Wells mixes with Edgar Allen Poe. Tesla, Edison, and Babbage merge with the Pinkertons and colonial politics. All of it maintains an outer facade of Victorian sensibilities, but on any deeper investigation it is as rotten as the worst parts of Jack the Ripper's Whitechapel London. Now take it all, make a civilization out of it, and run that civilization off city-sized power plants that are on the verge of absolute failure.

Steamfunk is everything that might be considered "steampunk," set in a dystopian world that is as much smog as it is steam and as much disease as it is discovery. It is a place of almost-panicked desperation, barely hidden by the thin shell of a "polite" society in decline. It is a universe decidedly in need of heroes, if you happen to know of any...

Steamfunk is a completely new, self-contained campaign setting that is rules neutral. It is ripe and ready to be rifled through for ideas to incorporate into your home brewed game, pre-published setting, or used whole cloth as your new game world! AND, for the Untold player, the setting naturally works with all our released Untold cards! No pesky mechanics changes needed. No conversions or instructions! Just download, read, and play - that's it!

127250.name: Ominous Horizons: A Palapin's Calling
127250.description:
Box Description:

+ Acquire spiritual armor and an array of divine weaponry!

+ Explore complex dungeons, mazes, puzzles and secret quests!

+ First person adventure!

+ Obtain the mantle of Paladin and defeat the ultimate evil!

+ Journey to numerous locations around the world!

-Put on the whole armour of God, that ye may be able to stand against the wiles of the devil.

Ephesians 6: 11
King James Version

-For He shall give His angels charge over thee, to keep thee in all thy ways.

Psalms 91: 11
King James Version

-Surely thou wilt slay the wicked, O God...... For the Lord is our defense, and the Holy One of Israel is Our King.

Psalms 139: 19 and 89: 18
King James Version

Over 250 scriptures that can be displayed in 3 versions of the Bible!:

-New American Standard

-New International Version

-King James Version

127251.name: Polaris SnoCross
127251.description:
Box Description:

If it doesn't say Polaris...
It ain't SnoCross!

Join the Polaris snowmobile racing team and dare to tame the mountain! Pull off a variety of insane tricks as you master the challenges of monster jumps, hidden pitfalls, shortcuts, and treacherous terrain.

Race against fiercely competitive AI characters, or take on your own friends in multi-player mode.

Feel your customized Polaris sled move, twist and turn just like a real snowmobile!

-16 fully licensed Polaris sleds

-Pull of front and back flips, cork screws, gyroscopes, and starfish

-Real physics engine begs gravity for mercy

-3 leagues - 10 SnoCross and cross country tracks

-The one and only snowmobiling game for the Nintendo 64

-Monster air

-Tunnels and caves

-Night racing

-Bomb diggety tricks

-Changing terrain

-Up to four players

127252.name: Brennpunkt: ADL
127252.description:
From the back of the book:

"Brennpunkt: ADL erlaubt einen Blick hinter die Kulissen der Allianz deutscher Länder, von dem Parteien- und Regierungssystem der Allianz und ihrem Justizapparat über die verschiedenen WWege der Magieund den Jagd- und Domestitzierungsmöglichkeiten bei hiesigen Crittern bis zu den aktuellen Sport- und Medientrends, und gibt Einblickin die wichtigsten Subkuluren der Allianzländer. Diese Informationen füllen den Hintergrund der ADL weiter aus und geben Spielleitern wie Spielern viele neue Möglichkeiten und Ideen an die Hand."
(Shadowrun Campaign setting Germany 2063)

127254.name: Air Mail
127254.description:
User Summary

In Air Mail, the player begins as a letter courier who is soon caught up in more serious events when war breaks out. The game takes place in a light-hearted, cartoon universe with airships.

127255.name: Fibble
127255.description:
User Summary

Fibble is puzzle game with stages heavily influenced by both pinball and miniature golf. The game tells the story of Fibble, a tiny alien creature who crashlands in a suburban yard. As the game proceeds, Fibble is reunited with his five crew-members: Byte, Vroom, Doc, Rango, and Klonk. Levels feature some combination of these characters, who allow Fibble to navigate levels in different ways. The goal of each level is to complete it in a single "flick." Once Fibble is launched, he uses both the terrain and his crewmates help to collect all the coins and stars en route to the goal. Gold, Silver, and Bronze medals are earned based on time, number of flicks, and coins/stars collected. Fibble allows players to share progress via facebook updates, and also includes microtransactions reminiscent of cheat codes. At the time of writing, it features 6 worlds totaling 47 stages. Fibble is the first iOS game released by famed developer Crytek.

127256.name: Who Wants To Be A Millionaire? Second Edition
videogameversion: North American Game Boy Color edition
videogamefranchise: Who Wants to be a Millionaire?
127256.description:
Box Description:

All you have to do is answer 15 questions. Sounds pretty simple, right? Well, it starts out easy but gets tougher. Every correct answer raises the stakes.... and the sweat factor. Every wrong answer makes you want to crawl back into your cubby hole. Pressure's on. Can you handle it?

127257.name: Frederic: Resurrection of Music
127257.description:
User Summary

Frederic: Resurrection of Music is a humorous rhythm game that casts the player as classical composer Frederic Chopin. The game featuers a vibrant and deliberately silly cartoon storyline in which Chopin engages in multiple musical "duels." Remixes of 10 classical compositions are included, and the soundtrack can be purchased separately. The game is not a Universal App, but is available separately on iPad, iPhone, and Mac OSX.

127258.description:
Blades of Legend is a party style secret roles game for 6-11 players.

Half of the players in the game are masters, who are trying to eliminate the other master in order to be the last remaining player. The other half of the players are wielders, who are the only ones able to attack. Each wielder is secretly bound to a master, and wins when that master wins.

Only by properly manipulating an opponent's wielders and leveraging the commands of your opponent's masters will a team be able to succeed.

Each player possess a blade in addition to his secret alignment. The blades are public knowledge, and give each player a specific advantage and power in the fight.
127258.name: Blades of Legend

127259.name: Jousting Field
127259.description:
From the Introduction:

Some of the local gentry's more ambitious and wealthy members decided to host a jousting event, to impress the citizenry, to curry favour with their own lord and probably to no small degree to win over the hearts of their beloved ones. On a reasonably flat field just outside town they had the jousting field set up. Stands and platforms for the audience have been erected as well as colourful tents for the competitors arriving from near and far. Although the joust is not the only competition, it is the most prestigious one. Thus all the other structures have of course been arranged around the centrepiece of the event, the actual jousting field. The field itself is covered with sand and framed by a low railing. A similar railing marks the centre line of the field along which the competitors will charge at each other.

127260.name: Connexo
127260.description:
This is the 4x4 version of the game Connex'Oh which uses a grid of 6x6 tiles and was also released by EdiGames.

2 players face each other across a large plastic board that contains a grid of 4x4 square plastic tiles. All tiles are divided into a black and white triangular half, with a landing space on each side for the playing piece of that color. Tiles have a handle stuck in the middle that enables them to be lifted up, twisted round and replaced without the risk of having pieces slip off. Both the black and white player have 4 stones of their respective colors that start on opposite sides of the board. All tiles initially face the same direction, so that no two touching sides have the same color and hence no "connections" exist on the board at the start of play.

By twisting tiles, players can create "connections" of identically colored halves, creating a corridor along which pieces of that color can progress. Each turn players either twist one tile in the aim to improve the available route, or move a stone along one of those routes. Players try to remove all stones in their color from the other side of the board. The first to do so is the winner. A tile that has just been lifted gets a red marker on it. It prevents that tile from being turned by the player who is next. Additionally, it also prevents 1 or 2 neighboring tiles from being turned, as long as a connection in that player's color was created to the neighboring tile(s) by the newly placed one. An elegant rule that prevents stalemates and adds another tactic to employ.

127261.name: Left 4 Dead 2 - Cold Stream
127261.description:
User Summary:

Valve is releasing Cold Stream for Left4Dead2. This DLC contains both brand new content as well as porting of several maps from the first Left4Dead game.

Cold Stream contains a community made campaign. Announced maps include ports of Death Toll. Dead Air, Blood Harvest, and Crash Course.

127262.name: SpellTower
127262.description:
A GAME OF WORDS. Find and eliminate words [in a grid a letter tiles]. 4 puzzling modes. Longer words, larger rewards. Tackle tiles and keep your tower low.

4 SINGLE PLAYER MODES:

1. TOWER MODE. No pressure here. Try and get the highest score possible out of 150 letters, eliminating small words to set up 7- and 9-letter block busters!

2. PUZZLE MODE. Every word you make adds a new row of letters! Strategic word finding at its best.

3. EXTREME PUZZLE MODE. Like Puzzle Mode, but with the minimum word length cranked up. Experts only!

4. RUSH MODE. Row of letters build up over time. Find words as fast as you can, but be careful you don't back yourself into a corner!

[Also, there is a DEBATE MODE for 2 players with two devices (and two copies of the game) to compete via Bluetooth.]

For more, see the the publisher's website at spelltower.com.

Source: The Developer Website.

127263.name: Globetrotter's Guide to Expeditions
127263.description:
From the website:

Undertaking an expedition to the distant parts of the world is not simply a case of packing one’s bags and heading off into the wilderness in the hope of having a jolly time. Underfunded, poorly equipped, and badly planned expeditions will encounter many hardships, with most never returning to civilization. To help ensure the best possible result, a significant investment must be secured, supplies purchased, travel arranged, papers signed, and guides and bearers hired.

This supplement contains new rules for players and GMs about to embark on a globetrotting expedition. Inside you'll find new character options, rules for securing finance, calculating overland travel rates, avoiding becoming lost, foraging and hunting, and boosting one's reputation through telling of one's adventures, as well as information on various forms of transportation. Also included are four new characters, and 33 sample henchmen.

127264.name: Journey Collector's Edition
127264.description:
User Summary

From the simplicity of flOw, to the poetry of Flower, to the awe of Journey this special bundle features thatgamecompany’s three award-winning PlayStation Network-exclusive titles.

Bonus content includes the original soundtrack for all three games, three exclusive mini-games from thatgamecompany, a 30-minute documentary about Journey, Creator Commentary play-throughs of all three games, exclusive Journey PSN avatars, and a 1-month subscription to PlayStation Plus.

127265.name: Raid, Trade, or Settle
127265.description:
This comes in a book called "If You Were There: Viking Times." It is for 2 or 3 players. The map extrends from about the Ural Mountains to Vinland (Canada). The object of the game is to collect trade tokens which are acquired by moving from space to space along a track on the map as directed by the roll of a die. Some of the trail squares have further instructions like "miss a turn" or "lose a token." Each player also begins with "life" tokens which can be lost along the way. Lose all 3 and you are out of the game.

The unique feature of the game is that it lasts for exactly 23 minutes so a timer must be provided. The amount of time represents 5 seconds for each year from A.D. 793 to 1066. This obviously makes for a very fast game.

The drawback of the game is that the movers and tokens and die as well as the timer must be provided by the players. They can use buttons or coins or parts from other board games.

127266.name: Ringworld Zombie
127266.description:
From 1km1kt.net:

RINGWORLD ZOMBIE is a fast paced, fully illustrated, Game Master-less role playing game set on a 1 mile ringworld, involving you – prisoners – and ZOMBIES. You may start playing straight away, reading the intro, and learning the rules as you move along.

127267.name: The Hollow
127267.description:
From the introduction:

They set out to make something from nothing. It’s not clear whether they succeeded or not. See, it turns out there’s a lot of grey area between something and nothing.

You’re alive, but you’re not real. You don’t have a soul. You don’t have childhood memories, because you don’t have a childhood. You don’t have parents; you have makers. And those makers forgot to give you a place in the world.

User summary:

This is a playbook or "skin" (character sheet and basic play rules) for the Hollow character.

127268.name: The Selkie
127268.description:
From the introduction:

The weight and crash of the water was your first home. There are times you miss it terribly, and raise your keening voice, and those that can hear are moved... closer. You have a removable pelt that you were born in beneath the waves. When you wear it, you look just like a seal. And when you remove it, you feel raw and beautiful.

You’re living on land now, far away from everything you’ve known; shocked by newness and possibility, burdened by longing
and the tyranny of choice. The air moves fast over you.

What do they call it? Ah, wind.

User summary:

This is a playbook or "skin" (character sheet and basic play rules) for the Selkie character.

127269.name: The Serpentine
127269.description:
From the introduction:

In ancient days, your family held dominion over this world. They were powerful, deadly, and wise. At least, that’s what they tell you. But all you’ve ever seen is empty faith and crumbling dreams. You just want to live your life like any other kid, but they have bigger plans for you.

They say that there will come a day when the serpent rules once more. That once again they will swap secrets with powerful allies and venom with powerful enemies. But they need your help first. After all, what is family for?

User summary:

This is a playbook or "skin" (character sheet and basic play rules) for the Serpentine character.

127270.name: 13th Age (Escalation Edition)
rpghonor: 2012 Golden Geek RPG of the Year Nominee
rpgpodcastepisode: RPPR Guest Game: The 13th Age – Blood and Lightning!
RPPR Guest Game: The 13th Age: Gobpocalypse!
127270.description:
From the publisher's website:

13th Age is a new fantasy roleplaying game, designed by Jonathan Tweet – lead designer of Dungeons & Dragons® third edition – and Rob Heinsoo, the lead designer of the fourth edition of D&D®.

“[13th Age] has just enough of the freedom I want from a tabletop game while also being able to balance the crunchy aspects. I was just about to swear off D20 games, too. So I’m glad I found this.” – Kirby Smith, playtester

In the 13th Age of the world, adventurers seek their fortunes in the Dragon Empire while powerful individuals known as icons pursue goals that may preserve the empire from chaos, or send it over the edge.

Players decide which icons their characters ally with, and which ones they oppose. These relationships, along with a personal history and a unique trait chosen during character creation, help define an adventurer’s place in the world of 13th Age and lay the groundwork for epic stories that emerge through play.
There are also fun new rules for hitting orcs and making them go splat.

An early draft of 13th Age was playtested by more than 200 gaming groups around the world. The game will be published by Pelgrane Press in September 2012 when it is ready; which may be in September 2012, or a bit later.

The Escalation Edition is an advanced pre-order of 13th Age.

127271.name: Koschupa
boardgameversion: Historische Spiele Zander German Wooden Edition
127271.description:
Koschupa is a hand-crafted three-player-game by Dieter Zander from Historische Spiele Zander.

Koschupa is short for "KOsakenSCHUbs-PArty" (jostling-cossacks-knees-up).

It's an Finger Flicking Game. The board is a circle whose outer parts are subdivided into the three player-starting-positons. Each player starts with nine pieces in his colour at the outermost of the board.

You flick your pieces to kick the opponents' pieces off board. If you manege to kick at least one opponent's piece off board while your own piece stays on the board, you can flick again. After the muximum of three consecutive flicks, your turn is over. The next one's turn starts.
If you're "Last-Man-Standing" you start the next round with eight instead of nine pieces. Your starting position will be one circlet further to the centre of the board. If you've reached the fourth circlet and you win the next round, you've won the game.

127273.name: Scrum
127273.description:
Scrum is a pure abstract board game that roughly remind Rugby.

Each player has a number of pieces that remain for the whole game (there is no capture). In addition, a special piece, the ball, is present on the board.

The goal is to bring the ball to the last row. Typically each player move consists of 2 player pieces movement. However, in special occasions, when the ball is surrounded by player pieces so that there only one exit cell, the player is only allowed one movement which consists of pushing the ball to this exit.

Even if the rules are very simple (one minute is generally enough to understand how to play), it is tactically and strategically deep.

Online Play


Jocly (turn-based, live play or play against the computer)

127274.name: Die alten Rittersleut
127274.description:
This is the google Translation of the german game description:

In several rounds of play, the Knights try individually or jointly to the respective places on the board to achieve victory. Failing that, they get handkerchiefs as favors and can move onto the barrel fields of the board towards the castle. Whoever reaches the castle, and has the most favorable evidence, winner of the rivalry.

In the middleage the players fights to get points to get to the castle. There are some fights I have to solve alone, other fights must be solved by all the players together. The player with the most points win the game.

127275.name: Fairy Land
127275.description:
The forest is full of activity. The King of the Fairies will soon return from a long journey, and everyone wants to receive him properly!

As the leader of one of the noble families of Fairykind, you compete with the others to impress the King with a splendid reception: Collect gorgeous and fragrant flowers and gather loyal animal friends while avoiding the tricky goblins and clumsy ogres! You will have to use the Fairies of your family to explore the forest and collect the most splendid ingredients for the perfect reception and gain the aid of the wise Druids and the Fairy Queen herself!

Fairy Land is a game that combines auctions, set collecting. and the timely use of "magical item" cards. At every player's turn, the woods will be filled by new animals, flowers or goblins/ogres – this will require some difficult decisions with players decicing which items go in which lots – then the player must use his single action to either start a bid on one of the woods (card groups), get one card from the druids, pay for a special item, or use one of the special item cards he owns. At the end of the game, sets of animals and flowers will be compared to score points, but players may also lose points for having too many goblins in their playing area.

Who can impress the King the most? Will it be you?

127277.name: Market Meltdown
127277.description:
Market Meltdown is set in a time of financial chaos, when the general public have lost faith in the Bank's ability to safely house their deposits and are withdrawing their money and transferring it to their mattresses. The players represent the traders investing the money on behalf of the Bank. As the game progresses players are faced with ever increasing pressure to generate bigger returns to pay back deposits and stay afloat.

The winner is the player who remains afloat when his opponents have gone bust. To begin, each player takes 900 million from the Bank and places their private jet on the Market Opens square. The Bank’s depositors are represented by a red sterling currency piece that also starts on the board, one square in front of the jets.

Players pay back their depositors at the start of every trading day. 25 million is due from each player on the first trading day, and the amount due doubles every day. Each player rolls the dice on his turn, and then moves both his private jet and the Depositors piece in a clockwise direction around the board for the number of squares indicated by the dice. A new trading day starts when the Depositors piece lands on or passes the Market Opens square.

The stock market is represented by a roulette wheel, and the roulette board is printed on the middle of the game board. Players go to market by playing roulette, with the returns on their bets being the same as those in traditional roulette. When the players land on a Data square, they collect market data, represented by stoppers. When going to market, players can place the stoppers in the roulette wheel, reducing the amount of open numbers and thus improving the odds of winning. Players still get the same return as in traditional roulette if they win. Players must contend with a number of other squares in the course of a trading day, including Data Wipe, Go Rogue, Arbitrage, Financial Regulator, Luck, and Banker’s Bonus squares.

127278.name: Internet Arcana
127278.description:
From publisher blurb:

Internet Arcana is a compendium of the entire SRD spells and magic items plus 30% OGC material (over 60 pages!) from e-publishers (Version 3.0 Only). Massively hyper-linked for user convenience, Internet Arcana contains over 4,500 links and anchors, bringing spells and items to your fingertips faster than ever before.

What makes Internet Arcana so useful?

1. Spell and magic item lists are hyper-linked to individual spell and item descriptions.

2. All spell descriptions list the magic items created with that particular spell, which is hyper-linked to the magic item description.

3. All non-SRD material is clearly indicated with red titles in both the lists and descriptions.

4. All non-SRD material is credited to the orginal source and the company that published it. These are also hyperlinked for customers interested in a particular supplement or company.

5. Besides extensive hyper-linking, Internet Arcana is fully bookmarked, indicating all non-SRD spells and magic items in red.

127279.name: Literarisches Quiz 2
127279.description:
Trivia about literature.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

127280.name: Literarisches Quiz
127280.description:
Trivia about literature.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

127281.name: Literarisches Quiz Kinder- und Jugendbuch
127281.description:
Trivia about literature for younger audience.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

127282.description:
Harun al-Rashid was the fifth Great Caliph of the Abbasid Dinasty, and he ruled over the Middle East between the years 786 and 809. His reign was full of prosperity in all areas, like culture, science and politics. His life and his famous court are said to be the ispiration for the "One Thousand and One Nights" collection of folk stories.

In Al Rashid, players will take the role of the heads of powerful families, and will use the members of their families for trading, travelling, and ultimately trying to exercise influence over the court of the powerful ruler.

Al Rashid is a mostly deterministic strategy game – with a slight hint of randomness – based on worker placement, influence, resource management, and the efficient scoring of prestige points (PPs). As heads of families, players will have three different worker types at their disposal: the Sage, the Merchant and the Pasha. The three different types of workers, each with a different influence value, can be placed on the map of ancient Middle East to gain resources, or can be placed on the corporations to get more workers, or on government and imperial offices. The corporations represent several powers at the court of the Caliph: Intrigue, War, Science, Commerce, and Politics.

The game takes place over five turns, with turns split into two main phases: the placement phase and the resolution phase. Each phase is split in several rounds. During the placement phase players take turns placing their workers on the board. During the resolution phase they take turns deciding which action will be resolved. Each action, either a zone on the map or a corporation, can hold workers from all of the five players, but only the top three players, identified by influence and placement order will get to resolve the move. During placement workers can be added to the same areas to improve a players's influence. Players with higher influence will get a bigger and better effect out of the action they are resolving.

Resolving geographical areas will give a player resources. The resources come in five flavors: Wood, Pottery, Metal, Spice and Silk, and they can be used in trades. The dominating player – that is, the one with more influence, or in case of a tie, the one who placed first – will get three different resources, or all of the resources of one type (resources are distributed unevenly on the map), the second player will get two different resources and the third player just one.

The resources gained by resolving geographical areas can be used in the corporations to buy more workers or get government offices. Government offices work more or less like buildings in other placement games. Some give permanent advantages, some have a one-shot effect, and some can be used every turn. As for the geographical areas, having more influence will be advantageous, and dominating players will get cheaper workers or better effects out of the corporations.

The game contains no currency, so players will need to be careful when they combine resources to get money because if they pay more than they should, no change will be returned.

Every turn raiders will spontaneously appear on random locations on the map, so players will need to use some of their actions to hire mercenaries that can be used to combat the raiders and give them access to resources. Players accumulate PPs when they buy offices and workers, and at the end of the fifth turn the player with more PPs is declared the winner.
127282.name: Al Rashid
boardgamepodcastepisode: TDT - Episode # 301 - Throwing Games Away

127283.name: Krimi-Quiz 2
127283.description:
Trivia game about crimes.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

127284.name: Begraben!
127284.description:
from the download page

In this one-shot set during an excavation by Miskatonic University, a tragic accident occurs that costs the lives of some workers and seals the characters in an extensive grave system. There they will face a horror that is not of this world. There are several pre-roled characters with specific background information, the scenario can be played in real time and, using a closed, room it is a kind of an egyptian survival game .

127286.description:
The Drum Roll: Mini Expansion consists of five new performer cards (two copies of each) and seven new personnel cards. The performers are:


The Acrobat troupe gains a Balancing Man, the first Acrobat to retire for 3 points.
The Tamers troupe gains a Bear Tamer, who retires for 4 points and lets you get cubes by paying money.
The Jugglers troupe gains a Ball Juggler.
Magicians gain a Cabinet Magician who has flexible performance colors, but costs 5 for hire and upkeep.
The new Bizarre act is a Sword Eater who is the first 5-cost-for-hire Bizarre act, but still retires for 1 x the number of Bizarre acts.
127286.name: Drum Roll: Mini Expansion

127287.description: Drum Roll: Dragon Dancers is a promotional card available at Spiel 2012. The Dragon Dancers belong to a new performer type called "Oriental"; the card is unique and has a new ability.
127287.name: Drum Roll: Dragon Dancers

127288.name: Masters' Series: Adventure 1 – The Deadly Hand of Zargon (fan expansion for HeroQuest)
127288.description:
The biggest challange to making these games has always been, How to keep it fresh and new. After making the 8th game in the adventure series, My Heroes wanted very much to keep the mercanaries. The quests got to big for the original board. So we created a bigger board. My first Son wanted more fighting, my second Son wanted more treasure, and I wanted more furniture. Add to this all the monsters, cards, tiles and rules from all the expansions and we created the Masters' Series. This is a very exciting adventure that we're sure your going to love. It will require a bit of work on your part to create the board and tiles. You will need to buy quite a few extra monsters and furniture for the game. But all of this is provided for you in the making a Masters' Series game booklet.
The pages for this adventure are available to download at "Dragonkingdoms.co.uk" and yahoo's group site "HeroQuest- hero quest" for free. You do need to join the group to access the file's section where they are stored. The photo section of this site will allow you to read the story and look at the maps to see if this game is something you would like to play. Your adventure awaits!

127289.name: The Netbook of Books (d20)
127289.description:
From Introduction:

As a preliminary, it should be obvious that the books described in this gaming supplement can (and often should) be tailored to your specific campaign world. This is the reason why most of the time names of religions and geographic locations remain vague or even not mentioned at all. This is up to the individual GM to adapt them to his own.

127290.name: Net Book of Classes, Tome 1
127290.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the Fantasy Netbook Community Council Netbook of Classes. This Netbook has been published as a community effort to increase the pool of classes, both core and prestige, available to player characters. This Netbook was designed in support of the D20 System environment.

As with any community project, there are several ideas, alternate rules, variants, classes, etc., that would never be approved or sanctioned by the official design team. This entire book is considered optional. You must seek your game master’s approval before using any classes presented here.

127291.name: The Council’s Guide to Classes, Volume 2
127291.description:
From Introduction:

Welcome to the Fantasy Netbook Community Council Netbook of Classes. This Netbook has been published as a community effort to increase the pool of classes, both core and prestige, available to player characters. This Netbook was designed in support of the D20 System environment.

As with any community project, there are several ideas, alternate rules, variants, classes, etc., that would never be approved or sanctioned by the official design team. This entire book is considered optional. You must seek your game master’s approval before using any classes presented here.

127292.name: October 2001
127292.description:
From Introduction:

What's New

New Feats this Month: We have added 79 new feats this month
Artwork Added: We now have two illustrated feats; Pack Mule and Cleave Asunder. Both illustrated by the incredible Darrell Langley. Darrell has done an outstanding job and we really appreciate what he’s done.
New Netbook Format: Anne Bernardo has let her talents shine once again and redone the netbook borders and layout. It’s now more professional than ever. We have moved the feats themselves to the front of the netbook and moved the boring legal stuff to the back.
Revised Legal Section: We have gone over the netbook and the feats looking for OGL violations and other legal matters. We feel that we have cleaned up some of the remaining problems and made the legal business easier to understand.
Revised Feat Rules Section: We have created a section just for the general feat rules and for explaining what feats are all about. Sections of the SRD were incorporated and the feat types were revised.
Database Driven: This is the first issue where the feats are stored in a database and then exported for use in the Netbook, this makes the process of updating the netbook much faster for future issues.

127295.name: Third Person Shooter
127295.description:
Third Person Shooter (or TPS for the acronym-hungry) is basically a tactical First Person Shooter transmogrified into a tabletop game. The intent was to have as few rules as possible, to avoid them getting in the way of the fragfest. TPS can be taught in under 5 minutes, and a game round usually takes less than 25 minutes. TPS scales well, and runs with little or no lag with 8 to 10 players!

TPS uses simultaneous movement and combat with a minimum of fuss and constraints, such as hexes or movement allowances. As such TPS has been accused of thinking far outside the conventional box for tabletop games.

TPS pits the Terrorists against the counterterrorists in the classic struggle for most frags and points to buy cool upgrades and fancy equipment. Supported game modes in v.1.0 are Hostage-rescue and Bomb placement/disarmament.

More features will come with future patches and major versions.

The future of TPS is currently uncertain - But in a good way - We are looking into doing a redesign and getting it published :)

127296.name: RedCat: De Razende Rekenrace
127296.description:
User Summary

'RedCat: De Razende Rekenrace' is an Dutch educational game to help learning math for 6 to 12 year olds. RedCat races together with Brutus the Bulldog and Max the Mouse over six different race tracks.You can get bonusses (like boosts) for your race by correctly answering questions.

127299.name: Extreme Paintbrawl
127299.description:
User Summary

A paintball based shooter featuring the Build engine used in Duke Nukem 3D

127300.description:
This expansion for Fantastiqa lets you become an Adventurer for Hire! Fantastiqa is required for you to play.

Components:


18 Special Delivery Cards (3 per terrain type; all 18 cards have unique flavor text)
8 +1 Point Bonus Tokens


Special Delivery cards reward your Adventurers for performing escort and delivery missions to Regions all over Fantastiqa. Special Deliveries may not always be glamorous, but the pay is good!

Examples include:


Return Five Stolen Chin Hairs to the Brooding Bridge Ogre Brenda!



Deliver a Supply of Decaffeinated Brew to the Nervous Necromancers of Groo!



Return the Forbidden Tome of Terrors -- Unopened! -- to the Lonely Librarian Lyria. (This book is overdue.)


Summary:
Each player begins the game with one Special Delivery card. Each card shows one of the six Regions in Fantastiqa (Fields, Forests, Frozen Wastelands, Hills, Highlands, or Wetlands). If you end your turn in a Region marked on your Special Delivery card, you complete the Special Delivery and add one Gem to your supply. You also keep the Special Delivery card (turn it face-down on your Adventurer Placard). Then redraw a new Special Delivery (you will always have one active Special Delivery card available.) Trade in three completed Special Delivery cards for one +1 Point Bonus Token.
127300.name: Fantastiqa: Special Delivery Expansion

127301.name: Outdoor Geomorphs: Set One: Walled City
127301.description:
From the front cover:

Outdoor Geomorphs
A D&D Playing Aid
Set One: Walled City

This set contains 22 - 5 1/4" square geomorphic city/town pieces and 11 - 2 1/2" X 10 1/2" additional city/town pieces which are semi-geomorphic.

127302.description:
In the Treasure Hunt Expansion for Fantastiqa, you stumble upon a curious collection of Treasure Maps. Use these maps—-and your dog-—to dig up mysterious treasures all over Fantastiqa! A new Victory Cup Quest is also added to the game (more on this exciting Quest below...)

Fantastiqa is required for you to play.

Components:

12 Treasure Map cards (2 for each Region)
14 Mystery Tokens (see details below)
12 +1 Point Bonus Tokens




Summary:
At the beginning of the game, one Treasure Map card is hidden face-down underneath the Quest Goal card. This Treasure Map indicates the Region where the Victory Cup is located--a final Quest required for victory!

During the game, one Treasure Map card is always visible as an Open Quest for any player to fulfill. To fulfill a Treasure Map Quest, a player must travel to the Region showing on the Treasure Map and dig there (using his "Dig Dog"). On doing this, the player claims one +1 Point Bonus Token and one Mystery Token (see below). The Treasure Map card is discarded face-up at the bottom of the Treasure Map deck and a new Treasure Map card is displayed on top (reshuffle as needed).

When one player reaches the Quest Goal, the Victory Cup Quest tucked beneath the Quest Goal is revealed, face-up, for all to see. The first player who fulfills both of the following conditions wins the game: a) the player’s score meets or exceeds the Quest Goal, and b) the player uses a “Dig” symbol (on his Dog card) to unearth the Victory Cup from the Region showing on the card.

List of Mystery Tokens:


Artifact: Draw one Artifact from the top of the Artifact deck and claim it for free. Immediately add it to your hand.
Beast: Draw one Beast from the Beast deck and claim it for free. Immediately add it to your hand.
Flying Carpet: Fly to any adjacent Region over a marked road. (Just like a regular Magic Carpet token.)
Magic Compass: Travel to any Region diagonally adjacent to your own (i.e., across the terrain occupied by an Open Quest card).
Pocket Portal: Teleport to any Region.
Potion of Persuasion: Use the potion to subdue any adjacent Creature while Adventuring (move your Adventurer as usual). Immediately add this Creature to your hand.
Secret Stash: The token is worth 4 Gems. These Gems do not count against you when the Mischievous Raven appears or when other players use Artifacts like the Rogue’s Purse.
