They cannot be stolen by the Mischievous Raven or by other players. Use these Gems just like regular Gems when purchasing items. No change is given.
127302.name: Fantastiqa: Treasure Hunt Expansion

127303.name: Oh Blondie!
127303.description:
This game is based on the comic strip Blondie.

Contents:

Spinner with positions for Blondie, Dagwood, Alvin, Baby Dumpling, Mr. Dithers and Daisy.
Playing board for each of Blondie, Dagwood, Alvin, Baby Dumpling, Mr. Dithers and Daisy.
Paper chips used to mark positions on player's boards




The obect of the game is to score points based on play.

Each player's playing board has 12 positions on which he can mark a point. Imagine 4 corners of a square. Now on each side of the square there are two positions between the corners.

You can mark one of the positions on the card whose picture you spin. If you get 4 positions along a side you must say "Oh Blondie" to score points.

There are there are other ways to score points.

127304.name: Heroo
127304.description:
HEROO is an abstract board game for 2 players, which can be played on a 6x6 or 8x8 board, with a checkers set of pieces for each player (you can paint the backside of pieces to sign promoted pieces) and 2 bishops and (a couple of pawns from a chess set might be used for the promoted pieces, instead of painting the back-side of checkers pieces).

Equipment:
6x6 board: 10 2-sided pieces for men and 2 bishops for the "specialists".
8x8 board: 14 2-sided pieces for men and 2 bishops for the specialists.

Rules:
Men: can move 1 or 2 cells orthogonally or diagonally forward.(backwards and sideways moves are not allowed for men).
they can capture by jumping orthogonally (in straight line) over an adjacent friendly piece and falling on an inmediately adjacent enemy piece, which is removed from the board, (backwards and sideways captures are allowed, but not diagonal captures).
Specialists: can move and capture in the same way than men, but in any of 8 directions.
Heroos: When a man reach the far rank of the board it´s promoted to "heroo". It can move sideways and backwards, but NOT FORWARD. It captures in the same way than men.

GOAL: The goal of HEROO is bringing back one heroo to the player's safe zone (2 first rows. just the first one for the 6x6 board).

127306.name: Boxing
boardgameversion: Einson Freeman Pub. Corp. First edition 1935
127306.description:
This game attempts to simulate a boxing match. Like a real boxing match the winner of each round is based on the number of points scored in that round. The winner of the game is determined by who wins the most rounds.

There are three spinners. The first spinner is used as a timer keeper to break each round into 6 parts (minutes:seconds) at 3:00, 2:30, 2, 1:30, 1 and 0:30.

The second spinner is used as such and indicates what happens with the punch. The third spinner is used as such too, and indicates the referee's decision when one is needed.

127307.name: Fairyland
127307.description:
Fairland is sort of a "Chutes and Ladders" type game played on a board of 100 spaces. However there is a significant twist. If you land on the bottom of a chute then you get some token to play to get by the top of the chute. For example:


At 9, you get meat to feed the lion
At 19 you get blinding powder to throw at the tiger
At 29 you must feed the pig a cabbage, but if you don't have a cabbage then you are sent back to space 4 to get one.


The requirement to have the token on some of the spaces generates a lot more "churn" than in a regular "Chutes and Ladders" game.

127309.name: Dictionary, Please!
127309.description:
This is a similar game to the well known Scrabble in that letters tiles are blind drawn and used to form words, and that the objective is to score points. However there are significant differences.

(1) The words are placed on table in a pool area rather than being in a crossword grid. So word two does not need to have a letter in common with word one.

(2) There are not points on the letters, but points are scored primarily based on the number of letters in the word.

(3) 350 letter tiles

(4) After each turn unused letters are put in a discard pool which subsequent players can used to make words.

127311.name: Krimi-Quiz
127311.description:
Trivia game about crimes.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

boardgamehonor: 2012 Vuoden Peli Family Game of the Year Nominee
2013 Guldbrikken Best Adult Game Nominee
127312.description:
In Enigma, players are exploring an ancient temple, solving different problems to make their way from room to room.

Problem solving is done simultaneously in four different categories — tangrams, block-stacking, canal-building and balance problems — and those who succeed expand the temple with the problem tile they solved, thus adding a new chain of rooms inside the temple or extending an existing chain of rooms. After placing a tile, a player can occupy a room on that tile with one of his three archeologists as long as no other room of the same color is already occupied in that chain. When the chain is closed — that is, when the chain has no "loose ends" that can be expanded upon — any archeologists in that chain's room return to their players, and players score 1 point for each archeologist they receive. The game ends when somebody reaches 15 points, and the player who has the most points wins.
127312.name: Enigma
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 29: Enigma and Macao
Episode 81-- Gen Con 2014 Top 11 to Try and Top 11 to Buy with special gues W. Eric Martin from BGG News
The Spiel #200 - CC

127313.name: Shakespeare-Quiz
127313.description:
Trivia game about Shakespeare.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

127314.name: Pocket Quiz: Englisch Wortschatz
127314.description: This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game for learning English. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

127315.name: Pocket Quiz: Englisch Aktiv
127315.description: This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game for learning English. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

127316.name: Pocket Quiz: Shakespeare
127316.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

All the questions are all about famous English poet William Shakespeare.

127317.name: Thousand Islands Railway
127317.description:
A track laying game set in Gananoque, Ontario, Canada. Players lay track, paying the cost, while angling to collect income based on connections and stations built along the line.

Released as part of Winsome's 2012 Essen package.

127318.name: Kulinarisches Quiz
127318.description:
Trivia game about culinary.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

127319.name: Fußball-Quiz
127319.description:
Trivia game about soccer.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

127320.name: Märchen-Quiz
127320.description:
Trivia game about fairy-tales.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

127321.name: Non-Essential Personnel
127321.description:
From the back cover:

Henchin’ Ain’t Easy!

But it’s not very fun, either. And the pay is horrible, too. Still, someone’s got to clean the carbon deposits from the planet destroying laser. And those pit traps aren’t going to dig themselves. When the super hero or super spy shows up, you’re the one who has to buy the evil mastermind enough time to arm the self destruct device. And how do you expect the captain to know just how deadly that alien creature is if there isn’t someone there to be brutally slain by it first?

So, if you’re tired of being the protagonist, or even the antagonist of your story, this is the book for you. Inside you’ll find all the rules you need to play the fodder, minions, thugs, lackeys, henchmen, and other assorted types of Non-Essential Personnel.

127322.name: Salamaua '42
127322.description:
Salamaua '42 is a solitaire simulation of the Australian commando raid of 29 June 1942 on the north coast of New Guinea.

The Australians must cause as much damage to the Japanese defenders while minimising their own casualties.

The action is regulated by a series of tables and the level of success is determined by the amount of risk the commandos are willing to take. The roll of the dice also makes the outcome unpredictable.

CONTENTS:
1 x colour map
180 x counters, mounted and ready-to-use
2 x double-sided player aid cards
1 x set of rules

127323.name: Hellsnight: A City Dies at Midnight: Stalking the Night Module 1
rpg: Stalking the Night Fantastic (1st and 2nd Editions)
127323.description:
From the back of the book:

MIDNIGHT It's a quiet night in downtown Detroit as the first in a series of strange murders takes place. Bureau 13 is notified and quickly arrives. They think they know the answer as they see the holes in the neck, but it is more, much more than a vampire. Hellsnight has begun.

Hellsnight is the first Stalking the Night Fantastic Casebook filled with adventures for hunters of the paraphenomenal. Seven adventures and a new information for Agents of Bureau 13 provide many hours of suspense as they stalk the Evil of the 1980's.

127324.description:
Storm Hollow: A Storyboard Game is a cooperative storytelling adventure game for 2-7 players that can be played in about an hour. Players assume the roles of heroes called to the magical land of Storm Hollow to aid in a time of need. Each adventure provides a stand-alone game scenario with a specific story-driven goal for the players to try to accomplish, and multiple adventures can be strung together in campaign mode to experience fully interactive epic stories. Players work together to fight monsters, overcome obstacles, rescue characters, find lost treasures, and drive back the darkness using a simple skill-based system and unique heroic powers. Goals and progress are tracked using the game board and cards, and each scenario provides a different set of options and path to victory.

In a Storyboard Game, one player takes on the role of the Storyteller and runs the adventure, while the other players work together to achieve the scenario goals. Each scenario is made up of three connected scenes in which the players gain information about the problem, solve story challenges, and try to defeat a final action-based encounter. Success or failure in each scene provides benefits or penalties for the next scene, creating a narrative arc that unfolds differently each time depending on the choices the players make. A Storyboard Game rewards collaboration, teamwork, and creative problem solving by presenting players with multiple ways to approach each challenge and allowing for innovative and fun solutions to be effective at accomplishing goals. In campaign mode each adventure, whether won or lost, affects how the next part of the story will unfold and what resources will be available to players in future adventures.

The game comes with one book of 10 linked adventures that can be used as individual game scenarios or played chapter by chapter in campaign mode to reveal a grand overall plot. Storm Hollow also includes extensive Storyteller tools and materials to create and play your own scenarios and campaigns, including a fully fleshed out world full of unique creatures, locations, and lore.
127324.name: Storm Hollow: A Storyboard Game
boardgamepodcastepisode: Awesome In The Pants
Episode 44 - Keep Up!
Funding the Dream on Kickstarter Ep 115 Story Realms Legal Battle
Funding the Dream on Kickstarter Ep 81 Story Realms and Angie Hickman

127325.name: Rock & Pop-Quiz
127325.description:
Trivia game about rock and pop music.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

127326.name: Bücher-Quiz
127326.description:
Trivia game about books and novels.

71 entertaining and educational riddles about movies. Three answers to each question. Answer correctly and get the card as a point. Player with the most points at the end of the game is the winner.

127327.name: Cubemen
127327.description:
User Summary

Cubemen is a hybrid game of tower defense and realtime strategy by independent studio 3 Sprockets. Unlike traditional tower defense games with units that do not move, Cubemen allows the player to adjust positioning of their defenses during combat.

127328.name: Pop The Question: The 70s & 80s
127328.description: A trivia game with a music theme. Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.

127329.name: Pop The Question: The 70s & 80s Extra
127329.description:
Add some extra cards for Pop The Question: The 70s & 80s.

Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.

127330.name: Pop The Question: Soul, Funk and Hip-Hop
127330.description: A trivia game with a music theme. Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.

127331.name: Pop The Question Extra
127331.description:
Add some extra card to Pop The Question Trivia game.

Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.

127332.name: Pop The Question: The 50s & 60s
127332.description: A trivia game with a music theme. Players have to guess the identity of the solo artist or band described by the clues on a cards. Each card has 6 clues, which are revealed one by one, starting with the most obscure, and leading to the more obvious. The first player to correctly guess the artist or band described by the clues receives the card. The player with the most cards wins.

127333.name: Kosakenschubsen
boardgameversion: Historische Spiele Zander German Wooden Edition
127333.description:
Kosakenschubsen is a hand-crafted two-player-game by Dieter Zander from Historische Spiele Zander.

Translation: jostling-cossacks

It's an Finger Flicking Game. The board is in the shape of an hourglass. Player-starting-positons are on the top and bottom of the board. Each player starts with nine pieces in his colour at the outermost of the board.

You flick your pieces to kick the opponents' pieces off board. If you manege to kick at least one opponent's piece off board while your own piece stays on the board, you can flick again. Otherwise it's your opponents turn.
If you're "Last-Man-Standing" you start the next round with eight instead of nine pieces. Your starting position will be one row further to the centre of the board. If you've reached the fifth row and you win the next round, you've won the game.

127334.name: X-Perts
127334.description:
User Description

You control a team of three commandos sent by the United Nations to recapture a nuclear facility from a team of terrorists. Like Lost Vikings, you alternate control of your characters to accomplish your objectives.

127335.name: Platformines
127335.description:
- A unique platformer with exploration, RPG and shooter elements set in a huge and hostile underground world.
- 6 to 10 hours of gameplay to finish the main quest.
- an infinity of world randomly generated for extended longevity (thousands of seamlessly streaming screens to explore).
- discover hidden chests, collect loot dropped from enemies including a gazillion of randomly generated firearms.
- pretty and humorous looking 16 bits graphics.
- customisation lets you generate thousands of different characters.
- a soundtrack mixing ambient atmospheric musics with remixed chiptunes of the classical masters.
- challenging but never impossible: find a place that's too hard? step back a bit, upgrade and come back to kick some.

Source: The Game Website.

127336.name: Time Killers
127336.description:
User Description

Death has summoned eight of the greatest fighters from the past, present, and future to fight in a tournament. Seven of those fighters are fated to die, but the winner will receive immortality. Time Killers features cartoon-style graphics with a lot of blood and gore.

127337.name: Laivynas
127337.description:
It's trading card game in which players are building their own fleets and then , using different captains, weapons and maneuvers, trying to beat each other.

At the start of game each player build their own fleets. Your fleet value could not be higher than 8.Each ship has different abilities, attack, defense and value. So you can build big fleet with a lot of weaker ships, small fleet with powerful ships or medium fleet with medium ships.

At the player turn he do these steps:

1. Draw 1 card
2. Choose flagship ( one ship which will be participating in battle)
3. Attack ( at this step, player must put captain card on the ship ( if that ship doesn't have captain yet). Each captain has different abilities and attack, defense values. After that players can use spacial cards to change their own attack and defense values. Attacker can use weapons and maneuvers, defender can use just maneuvers. When player don't want to use anymore cards, attacker attack value and defender defense value is compered. Player who has bigger value destroys opponent flagship)
4.End of the turn ( if attacker lost, he must assign new flagship and all destroyed ships,killed captains, used maneuvers and weapons are discarded)

First player to destroy all opponent's ships is the winner

127338.name: Asheron's Call: Throne of Destiny
127338.description:
User Summary

Asheron's Call - Throne of Destiny expansion for Asheron's Call and Dark Majesty Expansion. This is an individual, full expansion release.


From back of the box

The War is inevitable. The outcome is not.

Which side will you choose?

Your homeland is under siege. Massive forces gather under opposing factions. Conflict swells. The fate of your world hangs in the balance. Fight to forge a new future for the mystical world of Dereth. Join thousands of other players online to confront the challenges and reap the rewards of a new land. Experience the adventure of Asheron's Call: Throne of Destiny today!

- Explore the expanded world of Dereth featuring an all new graphics engine and interface.

- Play as a new heritage group, the Viamontians, and earn new mystical powers as you progress.

- Embark on new quests to collect and master hundreds of new weapons, armor, items, and spells spread throughout the world.

127339.name: Summoner Wars (2012)
videogamehonor: 2012 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Nominee
2012 Golden Geek Best Mobile/Handheld Video Game Winner
127339.description:
Summoner Wars for iOS is a digital card game with all the tactical elements of a boardgame. The first free-to-play app from Playdek, Summoner Wars for iOS allows players to control the Phoenix Elves faction and battle against AI opponents. Seven additional factions such as the Tundra Orcs, Guild Dwarves and Cave Goblins are available through the game’s in-app store, and online game play access is available after the first purchase is made. Players who have made a purchase can play online games with full asynchronous support. For those who wish to take the game to the next level, a deck-editor allows players to select the cards in their factions, within the confines of the rules. Changing cards can affect game play, making the game infinitely customizable.

Summoner Wars is a popular fantasy card game where players take on the role of a Summoner. Players cast spells and summon warriors to a battlefield and tactically maneuver them in an effort to defeat their opponent’s summoner. Summoner Wars offers many faction decks for players to choose from, like the precise Phoenix Elves, the hordes of Cave Goblins, or the righteous Vanguards. Each faction offers unique play and requires players to adapt to the special strategies available to that faction.

Features
• Free to Play
• Online play unlocked with first in-app purchase
• Phoenix Elves Faction included
• Four AI opponents
• 7 new factions to purchase
• 8 Reinforcement Card packs to purchase
• Mercenary Card pack to purchase
• Plaid Hat promo cards included in Mercenary Card pack
• Tutorial, Card Gallery and Rule Book

Source: The Game Website.

127340.name: Marvel Heroes Unite!
127340.description:
Portable lunchbox game. The Marvel Heroes are always equipped and ready to go and now you can follow suit. Have great time wherever your adventures take you. Heroes unite. Players 2-4.

Product Features
The Marvel Heroes are always equipped and ready to go and now you can follow suit
Have great time wherever your adventures take you
Heroes unite
For Ages 4+
Players 2-4

Players roll dice on their turns in order to match the superhero icons on the dice to the villains currently at large on the table. To capture a villain such as the Lizard requires one Spiderman icon. To capture Galactus requires one each of Captain America, Hulk and Spiderman. Players may reroll "misses" but once an "X" is rolled, that die cannot be rerolled so there is a slight press-your-luck element.

There are some wild cards that give players an icon of their choice. Some other special cards give players extra rerolls or force a player to give up one of their previously captured villains.

The winner is the player who has captured the most villains when the deck runs out.

127341.name: Fantastical Currencies: Kingdom Edition
127341.description:
Publisher's Description:

This product line exists in order to provide you with custom, attractive, and practical fantasy money to use in your games. Look out for many new products in the Fantastical Currencies Master Sets and our other great RPG visual aids and products.

127342.name: Fantastical Currencies: Kingdom Edition Vol 2
127342.description:
Publisher's Description:

This product line exists in order to provide you with custom, attractive, and practical fantasy money to use in your games. Look out for many new products in the Fantastical Currencies Master Sets and our other great RPG visual aids and products.

127343.name: Fantastical Currencies: Dark Kingdom Edition
127343.description:
Publisher's Description:

This product line exists in order to provide you with custom, attractive, and practical fantasy money to use in your games. Look out for many new products in the Fantastical Currencies Master Sets and our other great RPG visual aids and products.

127344.name: Fantastical Currencies: Dwarven Treasure
127344.description:
Publisher's Description:

This product line exists in order to provide you with custom, attractive, and practical fantasy money to use in your games. Look out for many new products in the Fantastical Currencies Master Sets and our other great RPG visual aids and products.

127345.name: HMS Relentless
127345.description:
From the Product Introduction

Encompass™ products provide game masters with settings and locations to enhance and expand the role playing experience they provide to their players. Each Encompass™ product includes high resolution, full color and black & white overview drawings. It also includes battlemats for the setting as well as player scratch maps. All the drawings are in PDF format for easy printing.

HMS Relentless
The HMS Relentless is a fully detailed, four level warship suitable for any fantasy campaign. The ship can carry a crew of your own making or you can use the captain and key crew figures included in the release. The warship is armed with 34 guns (12 and 18 pounders) and could carry up to 200 crewmen, though a small crew could sail her.

Included in the HMS Relentless are:
· Five full color overview drawings and five printer friendly, black & white overview drawings
· Five full color, tileable battlemat drawings and five printer friendly, black & white tileable battlemat drawings
· Five black & white player scratch maps
· Descriptions of the key NPCs and locations on the ship.

127346.name: Opener of the Ways
127346.description:
From the Back of the Book

Knights are more than just soldiers, as the Lance is about to find out. Pulled off the frontline, the Knights are assigned to routine policing duties within the Preceptory Estate. When security cameras catch an unusual murder, the team is immediately ordered to investigate. What they learn threatens the very soul of humanity, and the Church is not going to sit by idly and let that happen.

So the Knights must forgo their usual identities and head undercover into Salus’ seedy underworld--a world where violence and treachery is the norm. Their orders are simple--fi nd Mr Big and put him out of business. But is everything as it seems? And who can the Knights trust when one wrong word might mean certain death?

From the Product Introduction

Welcome to The Opener of the Ways, a standalone scenario written for the Necropolis 2350 campaign setting. This adventure deals with the mature themes of violence and illegal drugs. It does not glamorize drug abuse in any way, but the contents may not be suitable for younger audiences. Parental discretion is advised.

127347.name: Stak
127347.description:
There are a number of methods of play, but basically your are stacking wooden sticks with a square cross section for points. Different colored sticks score different number of points.

There is a certain twist in that the stack of sticks is made on top of a cone with a flat top. The cone is high enough to guarantee that a falling stack of sticks will create a spectacular collapse!

The game came packaged in a can with metal ends and the sides made of paper.

127348.name: Who's Afraid of the Big Bad Wolf
127348.description:
Basically the game is very similar to the much better known game Pachisi. Each player is trying to move his pigs from his starting position around a race track and get them to the brick yard, which is "home" for the game.

There are some differences to the regular Pachisi game. There are only four safe spaces marked on the board. Also there are special spaces which tell a player to advance or to go back a certain number of spaces. Also there are only three pigs, not four.

127349.name: New Game of Snake
127349.description:
The game is a simple race game somewhat similar to the better known Chutes and Ladders game. To play you'd need two dice (or a tee totem according to the rules...), a distinct marker for each player, and the game sheet. Presumably only the game sheet was sold and the player would have to supply the other components.

The 122 spaces on the game board are marked out along a snake. The start is "through" the snakes mouth which requires a 2 to pass. Space 122 is at the tail.

The game board directs forwards and backwards movements as in Chutes and ladders. However there are many differences to the standard Chutes and ladders game. The winner must get past 122 to win. Landing on some squares entitles the player to two throws, or causes him to lose a turn. A player unlucky enough to land on space 119 loses the whole game!

127350.description:
Bonus tile that comes for free with Plato Magazine no 45.

The background is purple and you replace one purple discovery with this tile.

At the end of the game, the owner of this tile gets 2 points for each settler (disc) that he has retreived, but hasn't placed on the board.
127350.name: Olympos: Expansionnism

127351.name: Wohnopoly
127351.description:
Promotional game for a house improvements company.

The board looks interesting, with a track around the edge of a house which has a wall taken away so that you can see workmen in every room.

The game itself is not so interesting, being a close relative of games like Ludo, Pachisi and Mensch. To spice it up, if you land on a brown square you get to draw a card and must follow the instructions.

The first player to get all four of their men home is the winner.

127352.description:
Football related card game. 56 cards featuring 21 different footballing terms.

Each player is dealt a hand of cards. The 'match' kicks off by the first player to have an Anstoß (Kick-Off) card. If no-one has such a card, each player in turn draws another card from the stack. This goes on until an Anstoß is drawn and played. Next player must play a card that is the logical action after the kick-off. A check list is provided so you can see which action card is acceptable. The game continues like this until one player runs out of cards. That player wins the round and the other players get a minus score depending on which cards they still have in their hand.

The player with the most points after an agreed number of rounds, wins.

127353.name: Panzer World Galient: Simulation Game
127353.description:
A tactical level wargame based on the Japanese robotech animation "Panzer World Galient".
Two editions of the game were published, in Dual Magazine #11 and 12. Each edition uses the same basic rules, but with different map and units.

Players control one or more Panzer Soldiers (the Robotech name in this universe).
Each turn, players secretly fill out the log for their action pattern and movement plan. Then, they simultaneously resolve movement and combat. The combat includes fire and close combat.

This game does not contain any scenarios. In the basic game, each player use one Panzer Soldier and battles to destroy the opponent. A skilled player can handle more units for large-scale battles.

127354.description:
The creators are back once again with another card expansion that adds more hilarity for us horrible people that like to play.

In this card game, players take turns being the Card Czar, which means they will read a black question card or a fill-in-the-blank statement card. The other players will select a white answer card from the 10 in their hand that they think best or most humorously fits the question/statement. The Card Czar will then shuffle the answers and choose the one they like best, with that answer's owner receiving the black card as his "awesome point" for winning the round.

Once a player has at least one awesome point, they can wager an awesome point when giving a white answer card in order to throw in a second answer card, giving that player a better chance to be chosen. The winner of the round will receive the original black card as well as any that are wagered in that round.

Play continues until a pre-determined score is reached, or until everyone is tired from laughing so hard.

This expansion adds 25 new black question/statement cards and 75 new white answer cards to the deck as well as 12 blank cards for players to come up with their own card ideas. And to top it all of, it's dolphin-safe!
127354.name: Cards Against Humanity: Second Expansion
boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode Twenty-Seven: Mad Against Humanity

127357.name: Arabian Nights
127357.description:
From the Back of the Book

The prosperity of a desert Sultanate is unraveling!

The Sultan is dead and the magical island of Karkadann crumbles under a scourge of ruinous djinn. What secrets were lost with the ruler’s passing? Our heroes delve into court intrigue, explore furtive desert hideaways, and travel a plagued land, looking for the answer. What they find won’t be pleasant, and in the end they must choose: defy the Great Spirit of Wishes or make a sacrifice....

In this Savage Worlds* adventure for Heroic rank characters you’ll find all you need to run a great session of Fast! Furious! Fun! It’s set among our Timeline realms, meaning it’s part of real world history, but with magic sprinkled on top!


A copy of Savage Suzerain is also recommended to get the best out of this book.

127358.description:
Topic: Animals, nature

The object is to be the first reaching target zone on the little game board by answering most questions correctly.
There are 2 question and 3 variants for each question on one side of the card. Currect player draws a card and hide the answers. Other players show answers simultaneously;
Players who answer correctly scores 1 point and move their pawns one point further on little game board.
If leading player moves upon a 'specail' space on the board: Last and second last Player run a 'Rock,Paper,Scissors' competition to make a step ahead.
Who finishes first on the game board is the winner.
127358.name: Willi wills Wissen: Tiere

127359.name: Savage Suzerain Player's Guide
127359.description:
From the Back Cover

Introducing a whole new rank to Savage Worlds -Demigod- and lots of toys to go with it. Over 50 new Edges, and an innovative approach to races is just the beginning.

Take your characters from one world to another or even to another time. History and fantasy; past and the future - they are all your playground now. Your gaming group just became...

...A Pantheon in the making.

This Player's Guide contains all the information you need to create characters in any time and place, then develop them until they become gods!

127360.name: November 2001
127360.description:
From Introduction:

The Netbook of Feats is published using Wizard of the Coast’s Open Gaming License (OGL). This legal document (found in the legal section of the NBOF) protects the work in this document so that it remains free for you to use in almost any way imaginable. Basically the material in the NBOF that is designated as Open Gaming Content (OGC), which is almost everything in the NBOF, can be used in any publication, armature or professional without any restrictions, except that you must credit the original author of the work. To use our feats you needn’t pay us, or ask permission, or sign any contracts, the only thing you must do is include the OGL in any document you use the material in, and you must abide by the rules of the OGL.

127361.description:
You and your friends are managers of a Formula Fun racing team.

The winner is the player who obtains the highest number of points over the various championship races in which he participates.

To take part in a race, one must have first employed drivers and signed contracts for the supply of an engine and chassis and manage the finances from the sponsorship cards.

The finishing order of the cars is determined by adding the value of the chassis, engine and driver cards of each car taking into account any effect shown on the Circuit card.

Your progress in the championship will be subject to various positive and negative Special cards for you and your rivals who will do all possible to put a spoke in your wheels.

Racing Manager is an evolved version of Racing Formule Fun which was published in French in 2010. The principal differences concern tha packaging which is bigger and which contains banknotes and tokens (the French version didn't) and there are no more texts on the cards. So some cards have been simplified.
127361.name: Racing Manager

127362.name: Desert Oasis
127362.description:
User Comment

A set of 8"x11" sheets which can be assembled into a desert oasis map gridded in 1" squares.

127363.name: The Warlord Games
127363.description:
Warlord is a small set of rules and 5 different piece types that are used in a series of scenarios. Each scenario is a structured multi-move abstract strategy game of battle using a unique board and setup.

Armies of 30 - 35 pieces are commanded by half a dozen leaders, any 4 of which may be active in a turn. Active leaders may move themselves or any friendly piece within 2 squares that has not already moved.

Each of the 5 pieces has a different simple short range move, and each captures an enemy piece by legally moving onto the enemy square, stopping, then removing the enemy piece.

Win by capturing half of your enemy's leaders before half of yours are taken.

127364.description:
Wsiąść do Pociągu: Komorów is based on Ticket to Ride Märklin Edition rules, but it's a little bit expanded. Generally all rules are the same (like in the TTR:ME) with one exception. There are four special "WKD" routes. When claiming such route the player has to throw a D6 dice and draw the corresponding number of cards from the deck. Now analogously to the tunnels, the player has to discard from his hand the adequate number of cards.

This game is made available as a print and play expansion for Ticket to Ride and may not be produced for commercial reasons.
127364.name: Komorów (fan expansion to Ticket to Ride)

127365.name: Wolfsworn
127365.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Wolfsworn rider is taught from birth how to care for, train, and make use a rare breed of wolf as a powerful ally and mount in combat. Wolfsworn are skilled warriors, trained for combat while mounted on the backs of vicious and oversized wolves. They can found charging across a battlefield, savagely destroying enemies who do not have the sense enough to flee. The Wolfsworn's true power comes from the ferocity of his mount, his combat prowess that he has learned, and the devastating carnage they wreak together. Wolfsworn tend to rush head long onto the field of battle, using brutal tactics to destroy enemies.

Crashing down the steep embankment, in a cloud of dust rising from its decent, the massive black wolf and its armored rider quickly covered the ground needed to catch the fleeing ogre. With a single command, the rider pulled hard on the reigns, sending the oversized canine into a savage rage and causing it to release an unnatural howl which echoed throughout the ridge. Hearing the sound of its death swiftly approaching, the ogre realized that there would be no escape. The hulking giant turned, it’s oversized club in hand to meet the pursuers in combat, but was only greeted by the powerful jaws of the wolfsworn’s mount closing around his throat and pulling it’s bulk onto the ground.

127366.name: Mutants & Masterminds Character Record Folio (1st Edition)
127366.description:
From the back of the book:

Your mighty superhero deserves deluxe treatment, and that's where the Mutants & Masterminds Character Record Folio comes in. Say goodbye to cramming your notes and super powers onto a single character sheet--the folio is designed to handle your superhero for the entire campaign. Its 16 beautifully designed pages include great add-ons like record sheets for your minions, vehicles, and headquarters, plus Crime Files that let you track important events and NPCs. The M&M Character Record Folio is good for any character, from a street-level vigilante to a being of cosmic power.

127367.name: Famous Zombies
127367.description:
Taken from Kickstarter page

The dead have risen from their graves and their only desire is to devour brains of the living. Sure, it's fun to tell your friends you killed a zombie. But it's even better to add "Oh, you may have heard of him." That's why these zombies are famous. Will they keep coming back? Most definitely. Will humanity survive? Not even close. But if you can take out a few of the better know walking dead along the way, then you could win.

Game Play:

Players use cards to place player tokens on different spaces. Placing them on the main board allows players to search for and use weapons to kill and drive back zombies. The trap area allows your tokens to electrocute or blow up zombies that wander across the board. Intel spaces allow players to draw additional cards. The more cards that are drawn, the faster the zombies come.

Zombies are constantly springing up and slowly moving toward the brains on the main board. When they reach them, players lose player tokens. Players may regain player tokens by using cards to recruit new allies from the "Eaten" space.

Zombies will come in waves. Sometimes they give you time to set up your strategy, and sometimes they emerge so quickly and in such large numbers that you must take action immediately.

Famous Zombies is a victory point based game that can be learned quickly and has enough choices to make strategy the most important factor in winning.

127368.name: Rise of the Runelords Anniversary Edition Player's Guide
127368.description:
From the publisher's website:

The Rise of the Runelords Anniversary Edition Player’s Guide gives players all the spoiler-free information, inspiration, and new rules they’ll need to create characters prepared for the daring and adventure of the Rise of the Runelords Adventure Path.

Within, players of this campaign will find everything they need to create character backgrounds tied to personalities and events vital to Pathfinder Adventure Path’s initial expedition into the exciting frontier of Varisia, along with new campaign-specific traits to give bold adventurers the edge they’ll need to take on the unpredictable dangers of that untamed land. This player’s guide features a full gazetteer of Varisia, revealing spoiler-free details of the land, both to chart their backgrounds and future adventures.

True heroes don't need to take on a risen Runelord unprepared! Gather your allies and let the Rise of the Runelords Anniversary Edition Player's Guide be your first step of the Rise of the Runelords Adventure Path.

This product is designed for use with the Rise of the Runelords Anniversary Edition.

127370.description:
This small expansion contains 2 new Battle Maps and were designed and offered during D-Day Dice's 2011 Kickstarter campaign.

The Battle Maps are:
Riva Bella Casino
Sword Beach II
127370.name: D-Day Dice: K-Maps

127371.name: d30 DM Companion
127371.description:
From the Back Cover:

The d30 DM Companion is an indispensable aid for any DM that wants to keep on top of his game and ahead of his players. Whether stocking a dungeon, looking to breathe new life into a campaign, or just struggling to keep up with players, this compilation of d30-based mechanics, charts, and tables will support and simplify the role of the DM/GM at the tabletop. Inside these 30-something pages you'll find a host of d30-based resources, including:


super-quick character generation for classed characters, including: attributes, motivations and equipment/inventory
general dungeon features, embellishments, debris, and geological phenomena
27,000 mold/slime variants and 27,000 mushroom variants
monster encounters for levels 1-9 (270 listings)
single d30 determination for ranges of "no. appearing"
monster stats for 180 monsters and 14 types/classes of humans/humanoids
900 trap variants based on 6 trap categories
treasure hordes (by type) in fewer rolls
27,000 unique gem-based treasure items
27,000 treasure variants of magical weapons and armor
27,000 variants of scrolls, potions, wands, staves, and rods
over 1.45 billion potion variants
60 new miscellaneous magic items


+ a master mapping key and a reproducible Dungeon Crawl Worksheet to assist DMs in mapping and stocking the rooms of their dungeons!

boardgamehonor: 2013 Origins Awards Best Historical Miniature Rules Nominee
127372.name: Brink of Battle: Skirmish Gaming Through the Ages
127372.description:
Brink of Battle: Skirmish Gaming Through the Ages is a miniature wargame rule set that allows players to recreate small combat engagements from any time in history. It is designed to allow players to play either one off games or a campaign that lasts over several battles.

Players can choose between three main historical periods, Ancient/Medieval (3000 BC to 1450 AD), Early Modern (1450-1880 AD), and Modern (1880 to present). Forces are created through a point-buy system, allowing players to customize the combat attributes, equipment, and special abilities of their troops.

A typical force is 3 to 20 miniatures, the game is played on a 3'x3' to 4'x4' tabletop, and can be completed in 30-60 minutes.

Three mission modes are included: Raid, in which the attacking force must capture an objective protected by the defenders; Recon, in which each opposing force attempts to cause the other to suffer casualties and flee; and Retrieval, in which both forces seek to be the first to find and secure an objective.

127373.name: Panzer Battles
127373.description:
From the companies website: www.panzerbattles.com

Panzer Battles (ages 10+) is a card game based on World War II armor combat in a fast and fun system for 2-8 players. All players start the game with five cards form the tank deck (their active tank units) and five cards from the action deck. If you ever happen to run out of tanks, it is game over.

Winning the Game

The goal of the game is to destroy all enemy tanks and artillery before they destroy you! the players decide what the total score will be for victory (typically 150 points). This may result in playing multiple rounds until someone achieves the agreed points to win the game.

127374.name: Black and White
127374.description:
Whispers traveled like thunder through both the choirs and legions, and even though the tones were different the message was exactly the same – it had been found. The end could now begin.

Set in an alternate but familiar world, Black and White pits two players against each other as they try to complete their agenda, namely to either prevent or begin the apocalypse.

In the game, players morally battle for the control of five key figures in the end time by either praising their virtues or exploiting their vices, while fighting to find and recover a holy artifact that holds the key to opening the first seal and bring the world to its end. This is achieved through the play of cards that affect either specific characters or less powerful cards that can target any character. At the end of each round of play, the first player rolls to take control of characters. This roll's success is determined through comparison to the morality score of each character. The player who takes control of each character moves it, trying to pick up and deliver the artifact to that player's own base.

127375.name: Steel Stars
127375.description:
The Earth is a dead husk. Having mined all of its resources, facing a population many times that which could be possibly sustained and slowly mutating it into a massive, cloying, choking city, we had no choice but to set our greedy eyes on the planets around us and conquer new lands.

After the Information War of the 21st century, the Corporations dissolved national borders and began a new war of their own: the Resource War. Like their European ancestors, who conquered and fought over new land, the corporations started to clash for control of the stars around Earth, as if they had claims to them from the moment of their conception.

Thus began the new arms race, but this time the lessons learned from past wars would be embraced and used to leverage as much advantage as possible. Research into more advanced abilities to control not only the battles, but the hearts and minds of the people who fight them would become key to victory.

Steel Stars is a game of intergalactic warfare amongst rival corporations in Earth's dark future with a near endless number of system configurations and multiple paths to victory – through the council, through research of technologies and advanced abilities, via the creation of popular utopian worlds, or by the might of your powerful fleets.

Each player steps into the powerful and all encompassing shoes of the head of one of the five corporations fighting for the control of the universe. You will need to use cunning, guile, diplomacy, deception, and tactical thinking to make the decisions that will hopefully bring victory, control, renown, and respect to your corporation.

In each round of the game, players select four actions to perform. Players in turn perform one of these. Whenever an action is performed, all other players may also perform that action. The available actions are: Fleet (move ships), Research (develop tech), Council (Create votes on new rules), Planetary (develop your civilization), Energy (generate resources) and Logistics (build new ships). Players score points for colonising worlds, developing tech, building colonies, passing votes and developing their civilisation. The game ends when one player has accumulated 15 points, but that player does not necesarily win, as there are bonus points scored for being the best player in each of several categories.

127376.name: Ys Origin
127376.description:
Taking place 700 years before the events of "Ancient Ys Vanished" (Ys I & II), this game tells much of the backstory of Ys, Darm Tower, the Black Pearl, the twin goddesses and the six priests. The game revolves around three characters as they journey through Darm Tower: Yunica Tovah, Hugo Fact and Thor Fact. Each character has their own motives for climbing the tower and playing through with all three characters will reveal the entirety of the events taking place.

Source: Wikipedia, "Ys Origin", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127377.name: Fortune Summoners: Secret Of The Elemental Stone
127377.description:
So just what is Fortune Summoners, you ask?

Fortune Summoners is a story about being young. It's a story about finding adventure, about doing good even when doing good is hard. It's a story about owning up to your mistakes and making them right, and facing down danger no matter what. Furthermore, it's a video game.

Gameplay in Fortune Summoners consists of side-scrolling action, with you in control of one of three party members and the computer controlling the other two (with highly customizable AI dictating their actions). You will explore towns, delve dungeons, climb towers and, just maybe, find Arche a snack or two.

Combat is different depending on who you control - Arche, being a swords-girl, controls in a fashion similar to a character from a brawler or fighting game, with many special moves tied to button combos. Sana and Stella, her companions, rely more on their varied selection of spells to see them through a fight - spells that rain ice down on enemies, make mirror images of friends, or set the ground ablaze!

Their magic comes from elemental stones: stones imbued with the power of an Elemental Spirit, which grant the wielder of one the ability to control that element via "magic". In the country of Scotsholm, three centuries have passed since they were first created. Elemental stones are now mass-produced and widely used, making magic a personal, commonplace part of people's lives.

In Scotsholm lives an energetic little girl named Arche Plumfield. Arche, having moved to a new home in the town of Tonkiness, ended up attending the only school in the area.

It is the school for children aspiring to be magic users: the Minasa-Ratis Magic School.

Source: The Publisher Website.

127378.name: Persona 4 Arena
videogamehonor: 2012 Game Critics Best Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Multiplatform Game of the Year Nominee
2012 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Soundtrack of the Year Nominee
2012 Spike Best Fighting Game of the Year Winner
2013 D.I.C.E. Fighting Game of the Year Nominee
127378.description:
The game is set over two years after Persona 3 FES's The Answer, and two months after Persona 4's True Ending. As a result of Teddie's sudden disappearance in Inaba, his comrades from the Investigation Team begin watching the Midnight Channel, where random people are often seen, in hopes of spotting him. They find what appears to be Teddie in a pirate outfit announcing a fighting tournament called the "P-1 Grand Prix" to see who is the "Ultimate Persona User". Confused by this turn of events, the group agrees to reunite and enter the tournament to find out what has happened to their friend, as well as see who among them is the "Ultimate Persona User". All of the characters are also meant to have their own original storylines.

Source: Wikipedia, "Persona 4 Arena", available under the CC-BY-SA License.

127379.name: Urzeit-Tiere
127379.description:
"Prehistoric Animals"

The nature quiz for children with 32 color printed cards held together by a hinge.

Whether the answer is correct player scores a point.
At the end of the game the player with the most points wins.

127380.name: Schlangen, Echsen & Co.
127380.description:
"Snakes, lizards & Co."

The nature quiz for children with 32 color printed cards held together by a hinge.

Whether the answer is correct player scores a point.
At the end of the game the player with the most points wins.

127381.name: Leben an der Küste
127381.description:
"Life on the coast"

The nature quiz for children with 32 color printed cards held together by a hinge.

Whether the answer is correct player scores a point.
At the end of the game the player with the most points wins.

127382.name: Leben im Meer
127382.description:
"Life in the Sea"

The nature quiz for children with 32 color printed cards held together by a hinge.

Whether the answer is correct player scores a point.
At the end of the game the player with the most points wins.

127383.name: Kinder fragen ... wieso, weshalb, warum?
127383.description:
"Children ask ... why?"

63 cards age-appropriate questions and answers are represented.
Answer correctly and win the card.
Player with the most points if the deck is exhausted is the winner.

127384.name: Tiere der Welt
127384.description:
"Animals of the World"

63 cards age-appropriate questions and answers are represented.
Answer correctly and win the card.
Player with the most points if the deck is exhausted is the winner.

127385.name: Fussball
127385.description:
"Football"

63 cards age-appropriate questions and answers are represented.
Answer correctly and win the card.
Player with the most points if the deck is exhausted is the winner.

127386.name: Learning English
127386.description:
"Learning English"

63 cards age-appropriate questions and answers are represented.
Answer correctly and win the card.
Player with the most points if the deck is exhausted is the winner.

127387.name: Bauernhof
127387.description:
"Farm"

63 cards age-appropriate questions and answers are represented.
Answer correctly and win the card.
Player with the most points if the deck is exhausted is the winner.

127388.name: Quiz-Fächer Mein erstes Pocket-Quiz
127388.description:
A quizgame for the youngest players. The cards are held by a screw and can be ideally taken on travels,
More than 1,100 questions and answers - themes: nature, animals, seasons, shapes, colors, maps - ideal for travel -
the answers are always on the next page. The quiz can be played alone or by several players.

127389.name: Professional: Turn professional and make a million
127389.description:
Professional is a dice rolling game where players go around the board "training" themselves in any of the four sports in the game: golf, snooker, tennis and track. It has a board resembling a Monopoly board with spaces with sports competitions, training, and both specified and random events. The game features five decks of cards: One for each sport and one for random events, much like the Chance cards in Monopoly. Also included is a variety of paper currency.

The goal of the game is to train oneself and compete in the various sports to gain a million dollars. The first player to obtain that amount wins. The tournaments are divided into minor and major competitions with varying prize amounts for the first two places, as well as a "walkover" prize which will be handed out if only one player were to enter the competition. Training cards can be obtained in the training spaces. These cards are not only necessary to gain access to competitions, but can also boost the "skills" of the player when dice are rolled. Throwing dice is done to move on the board as well as determine competition winners, with the highest rolls winning unless card modifiers are in play. Other spaces include sponsorship funding, income taxes, injuries, travel fees, sporting luck (chance cards) and the start square, which trains a player in all sports.

While the game cover says that it supports 2-6 players, the rules inside the box mention 3-6 players. While it can be player with only two players, the game works much better with more players. Even 3 is quite few and in order to really play well, at least 4 players should be present as the competition dynamics really require that many players.

It was made and printed in South Africa.

127390.name: Celts
127390.description:
Publisher Comments

To make that first RPG experience even more memorable and exciting, Arion Games brings you this miniatures pack, full of visual goodies. All in full glorious colour, and easy to use, this set will make an instant impression on any young gamer.

127391.name: Saxons
127391.description:
Publisher Comments

To make that first RPG experience even more memorable and exciting, Arion Games brings you this miniatures pack, full of visual goodies. All in full glorious colour, and easy to use, this set will make an instant impression on any young gamer.

127392.name: Monsters
127392.description:
Publisher Comments

To make that first RPG experience even more memorable and exciting, Arion Games brings you this miniatures pack, full of visual goodies. All in full glorious colour, and easy to use, this set will make an instant impression on any young gamer.

127393.name: King Arthur
127393.description:
Publisher Comments

To make that first RPG experience even more memorable and exciting, Arion Games brings you this miniatures pack, full of visual goodies. All in full glorious colour, and easy to use, this set will make an instant impression on any young gamer.

127394.name: Pocket Quiz: Mehr Gedächtnistraining
127394.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information. Most of the cards also show small illustrations.

The ultimate knowledge-check! Test your skills on the subject of more brain training! Confusing and challenging puzzles to think and thinking around the corner. 50 exercises and solutions

127395.description: Essence: Archetypes & Emotions, the first expansion for Essence: The Game of Insights, allows the players to shed light on their emotional realm and to discover the archetypes which prominently reflect in their being.
127395.name: Essence: Archetypes & Emotions

127396.name: My Toy Shelf
127396.description:
This is a sorting and matching game for young children.

The board is a 3-D toy shelf. Players are required to draw random tiles illustrated with pictures of toys. The tiles are crafted in geometric shapes, and certain cards require the placement of a triangle, a square, etc. The child must match the tile to the appropriate spot on one of the shelves. A squirrel named "Rascal" can appear on one of the cards to mess up the display. The first kid to complete a set is declared the winner.

Includes the 3-D shelf assembly, 12 shape cards, 13 toy cards, and the rules.

127397.name: Pocket Quiz: Kopftraining
127397.description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with confusing and challenging puzzles to think and thinking around the corner. The backside of each card contains the answers.

Solve the puzzle first and get the card as a point. Player with the most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

boardgameintegration: Die Legenden von Andor: Die letzte Hoffnung

127398.description:
Game description from the publisher:

Legends of Andor is a cooperative adventure board game for two to four players in which a band of heroes must work together to defend a fantasy realm from invading hordes. To secure Andor's borders, the heroes will embark on dangerous quests over the course of five unique scenarios (as well as a final scenario created by the players themselves). But as the clever game system keeps creatures on the march toward the castle, the players must balance their priorities carefully.

At the heart of Legends of Andor is its unique narrative, the linked scenarios of which tell an overarching story as the players successfully complete objectives. For each scenario, or "Legend", a legend deck conveys the plot of an ever-unfolding tale...one in which the players are the protagonists. A wooden marker moves along the board's legend track at key points during each scenario, triggering the draw of a new legend card, the introduction of new game-altering effects, and the advancement of the story's plot. In the end, the players must endeavor to guide the fate of Andor through their heroic actions, bringing a happy ending to their epic fantasy tale.

Will their heroes roam the land completing quests in the name of glory, or devote themselves to the defense of the realm? Uncover epic tales of glory as you live the Legends of Andor!
